39139025.review:
ゲーム内容としましては、面白いです。格ゲーやった量が少ないので詳しいことはわかりませんが、コンボゲーとして面白いと思います。
対人を基本しないのでマッチングに関してはノーコメントで。
格ゲー初心者の方だとコンボ的な部分が難しいかもしれません。時間をかけて仕様を理解すればカットインが出せると思います。根気よく頑張りましょう。

ついでなのでこのゲームとの出会いでも書き込んでおきます。

3年前、友人邸で初めてやった格闘ゲームがこれだった。(多分カニファン限定版)
2年間連絡のなかった中学の友人に誘われ、MGS5、BF4と共に遊んだゲームの一つだ。
「コンボ出ないとこのゲーム無理やで」とか言われ、完全にレバガチャ状態でプレイしたことを覚えている。
その時使っていたのはシエル。今思うとレバガチャしてても比較的動きやすいキャラだったのかもしれない。
友人たちがコンボ決めてカットイン連発させているのを見て、「凄いな」と思ったし、「俺もここまでやってみたい」とも思うようになった。

それから一年。受験生時代のクリスマスになぜか自分の中でメルブラブームが発生し、地下鉄料金をケチって一時間半歩いてメルブラ筐体のあるゲーセンまで出かけた。100円2クレという良心的な額に感動し、塾の授業の始まるギリギリまで100円を入れて遊んでいた。この時メインの使用キャラとなるネコヒスイを使う。

その年の元旦にSteam版を購入。センター試験2週間前にゲームを買う狂ったやつになっていた。受験を終わらせてメルブラしよう。そんなことも考えていた気がする。購入後すぐにパソコンを封印した。

あれから一年がたち受験生時代の志望校に進学することができた。MBAAのおかげなのかもしれない。3月は狂ったようにプレイしていたが、今ではMBAACCで遊ぶ友人はおらず、気晴らしにやる程度のゲームとなってしまった。だけどこのゲームのおかげで友人とコンタクトが取れるようになったり、カニファンという神アニメの存在を知ることができたり、FGOが流行る前に少しだけキャラを知ることができたりした。

なんだかんだ言っても今やっても面白いし、良いゲームだと思う。
あと白レンは可愛い。3年前見たときからずっと思ってる。

Gran juego de pelea, con personajes de la novela visual "Tsukihime" y "Kara no Kyoukai". (Go read/watch them)

Para los casuales en estos tipos de juegos y/o fanáticos de la franquicia tenemos una historia por personaje en el modo Arcade, dándonos una ¿continuación? ¿realidad alternativa? de los hechos ocurridos en el original.

Y para los amantes hardcore de las mecánicas de lucha tenés 
3 estilos diferentes para cada personaje, una "heat gauge" con la que planear tu estilo de juego y una buena cantidad de combos disponibles.

Además la banda sonora es tremendamente pegadiza y para nosotros los estudiantes de japonés, podés dejar menús y diálogos en su idioma original.

10/10

With this much development time behind it and the fantastic character design work of Type-moon's Takashi Takeuchi you've got a fighting game that manages to stand out among even the newest games of this style.

37142289.review:
As a fan of Type Moon's two main franchises, I have been waiting a long time for this series to be localized in English. The wait was definitely worth it, and an official translation is finally available for the Western market. The only deception: this is not the first opus in the series, and previous titles are not yet available, and the story often refers to past events, that could be confusing for a new audience.
That said, even for a non fan the game is very enjoyable, fights are fast paced, combos are easy and intuitive to execute, the sprites are very pleasant, this is a must play for any 2D fighter gamer!

36470639.review:
[h1]TYPE-MOON「月姫」のスピンオフSteam降臨[/h1]

自分のスペック
Intel HD Graphics2000(オンボ)
このスペックで問題なく動く軽さもウリ。

格闘ゲーム業界が低迷していた時、
同人から商業に上がってきてゲーセンを活気づかせた伝説を持つ格闘ゲームの最新版。

鈍重なキャラを動かすイメージだった格闘ゲームに、
操作が羽の生えたように軽いキャラが画面を所狭しと暴れまわる、
ハイスピードバトルを持ち込んだ作品。

コマンド技が他の格闘ゲームほど重要ではなく、
初心者なら弱攻撃連打からの強攻撃シメという単調なコンボでも十分気持ちよく慣れるのが特徴のゲーム。

ストレス解消用に持っていても損はないゲームといえる。

さらに魅力的なキャラが多数登場して、女性の比率が多いのも特徴である。
同メーカーのヒット作「Fate」とは平行世界となっており、
Fateは「聖杯戦争」が世界を脅かしているのに対して、
「月姫」では「吸血鬼」の存在が世界を脅かしている。
平行世界なので共通している部分も多い。

またこのゲームは、シナリオもすべて奈須きのこによる描き下ろしでキャラクターやCGも武内崇が担当している。
小説「空の境界」のキャラもゲスト参戦。
さらに声優陣もかなり豪華。

対戦をするとなるともちろんコンボや複雑なシステムを把握する必要があるが、
Steamの格闘ゲームは概ね過疎っているので、これでネット対戦を期待するのはツラいかも。
その代償として、実績獲得にネット対戦要素が入っているので、
実績コンプの難易度は相当高くなってしまっている。

他の型月作品、最近ならFGOにハマっている人もいかがだろうか。

35625881.review:
This game has one of the world’s best fighting mechanics I have ever seen. And this is backed up with years of experience with this game (previous game versions included) and others. 

This game goes back years and honestly not much changed but that’s why its one of the better ones out there.

The character list goes up and beyond with 31 characters to choose from, but wait, each character has 3 different “Moon” styles included. Not only they vary in skills and general fighting style but the “Moons” put more mix in it. 

I don’t know if its because the game goes back so much or just generally, but the story is hard to gasp and seems random at first. To get a better understanding of it, you either play the old ones or read about it, otherwise just go with the confusion. The whole story is worth checking out, but I can understand those who don’t have much time and don’t know the backstory.

To summarise, this game is a real gem amongst fighting games and truly deserves more credit. The fighting is intense and enjoyable and the characters are so colourful and unique, you surely will love at least one of them. Maps and music are good, story a bit hard to follow but in overall the game is GOOD. Netcode could have used a bit more love and some features have been missed, but its acceptable. You can still find players around, but its better to check the forums and sync up your time together for fun fighting sessions.

I love this game so much, and I will continue supporting it as much as I can. Hope to see a possible sequel in the future, and to see where the twisted story will go. Thank you very much!

35077763.review: Vaya, ¿qué puedo decir? Para mí es el mejor juego de peleas que me ha tocado jugar, lo he seguido desde su primera edición, el Melty Blood original de la PC, al poco tiempo que TYPE-MOON y FRENCH BREAD lo publicaran como juego doujin y sinceramente he visto la gran evolución que ha tenido el juego a lo largo de todas sus versiones, y sinceramente tienen que jugar el juego original de donde se basó toda la historia: TSUKIHIME. Me enamoré de ese juego y la historia ha continuado aquí en Melty Blood; con todas las actualizaciones que le han hecho, se siente totalmente diferente a la versión anterior Act Cadenza ver b, de la pc; sin importar mucho el lado online, el cual no he probado, yo recomiendo ampliamente el juego solo por el hecho de tener un modo arcade muy retador en su máxima dificultad, y dominar a todos los personajes es un reto muy bueno; graficos fluidos y muy buenos actores de doblaje japoneses; puedo seguir nombrando, pero mejor me dentengo. Solo puedo decir: ¡es una excelente compra y la recomiendo totalmente!

34564497.review:
Já tinha sido apresentado a este fantástico jogo de luta no Melty Blood Re-Act e Act Cadenza e posso dizer que o Actress Again é o Melty Blood definitivo,pegando o que os jogos anteriores tinham de bom e acrescentado coisas novas que o tornaram ainda melhor.
Melty Blood não é um jogo dificil de se jogar más é um jogo dificil de se dominar todas as mecanicas dele com absoluta precisão,já que ele permite que você faça combos simples apenas combinando os botões de ataque fraco,médio e forte em sequência até combos que podem durar infinitamente dependendo do personagem,tem um botão de parry,combos aereos ,esquiva.
É um jogo que agrada tanto quem gosta de jogar casualmente quanto quem procura um jogo competitivo.
E agora cada personagem tem 3 versões (crescente,half e full moon)e o estilo de luta do personagem muda radicalmente dependendo da versão.
Recomendo este jogo ele vai com certeza lhe entreter por um bom tempo.

34518750.review:
Bueno... No soy precisamente fan de Tsukihime, pero si soy fan del género de peleas, y este Melty Blod me gustó. La primera vez que jugué un Melty Blood fue en octubre de 2014. Empecé con Melty Blood Act Cadenza, me pareció un juego bastante rápido, controles fluidos, buenos combos, y algo de comedia. Luego, hace como un año, encontré a Melty Blood Actress Again en Steam, que agreaga más personajes, los controles se sientes aún más suaves, y 3 estilos para cada uno. 93 combinaciones! 93 razones para desperdiciar mi talento.

De pronto, algo malo es que el online no funciona y que la comunidad está inactiva (No muerta, inactiva. En mi opinión, decir "el juego está muerto" es inapropiado, si así fuera, nadie lo jugaría ni harían torneos o retas)... o eso dicen. Yo la verdad no juego online así que ese tema no me preocupa. Adeás, le faltan alguos modos que si salen en la versión de PS2.

Entonces, ¿Recomiendo el juego? Sí, es rápido y dinámico, los combos básicos salen casi que de forma natural, en en mi opinión, amigable con los novatos, como yo, que no pueden ni les interesa jugar competitivo; pero lo bastante profundo para que los hardcore se deleiten (O eso dicen, la verdad no me consta). Una alternativa económica para los que no se pueden costear un Street Fighter V, o un Tekken 7.

¿Mi main? No me pregunten eso que ni yo lo sé. ¡El Random Select es Vida!

34160374.review:
This game is fun in short bursts, but in those short bursts, I had a good time. The story is REALLY obscure as far as structure and narrative goes, and there's so many references to religion, and obscure myth, that it can often be overwhelming. This is what I actually DISLIKE about Type Moon stories. Mythology ends up being too important for the story to make sense. But, as this is a fighting game, I am not here for the story. So, how is the fighting? Pretty good, I would say, and there's no real major gripes from me. However, I need to stress this, DO YOUR RESEARCH on this game. Otherwise, you're going to be lost. There is NO TUTORIAL or challenges in this game, so figuring out how a character works is really down to you. Here are some of my finer points and gripes below.

+AMAZING soundtrack. I feel like this needs no mention, but I should anyway. If a piece of music in a game can keep my toes tapping, and keep me listening for a half-hour plus, then you KNOW it's good. The names of the tracks are a little weird, though...
+ Fun and simple, albeit deep combat system. When I said there's no tutorial, and made it sound like a gripe, I meant it as a complaint. There's no tutorial, which means, while yes, the game is simple to get a hold of, you will need to mess around quite a bit to get the hang of things. That being said, not to spoil it, I do quite enjoy the setup this game has. A few mechanics escape me at the moment, but it's nothing overly confusing.
+ The sprites are just bursting with life. The sprites may look like something out of 1997, but for what is worth mentioning, it's the animations and how much life is in them that make the sprites amazing. Also, let me just say that the backgrounds, while some are rather plain, are rather well-done. I also love the VFX of this game, so overall, great visual design.

- NO ENGLISH DUB
- STORY IS TOO OBSCURE TO GET A HOLD OF
- NO TUTORIAL!!!
- Not enough content for the price
- Online community is dead

Overall, I give this an 8/10.

Also, I would FUCK THE EVER LOVING HELL out of Riesbyfe, gender be damned.

33512750.review:
격투 게임으로는 잘 만든 게임. 넷플레이만 빼고.
인기 원작을 기반으로 한 매력적인 캐릭터들로 싸울 수 있다는 점이 가장 큰 매력이고, 각 캐릭터들의 스토리는 물론 성우들의 혼을 실은 연기는 소름이 돋고, 심지어 격투 게임적인 완성도도 굉장히 높다. 근데 넷플레이는 구려.

기본적으로 공격자가 유리할 수 밖에 없는 2D 격투게임에서, 그것을 완화하기 위해 실드, 실드벙커, 각종 리버설, EX가드, 무적이 달린 백대시, 회피 등 갖가지 기술을 넣어서 일방적으로 진행되는 게임을 최대한 줄였다.

넘치는 어퍼 효과의 기술로 같가지 루프가 들어가고, 바닥꽝이나 벽꽝이 두 번 까지 되기 때문에 날리기 계열의 기술도 기본적으로 3루프가 까지 가볍게 가능하고, 리액트(퍼올리기) 효과도 생겨서 진짜 상상 할 수 있는 대부분의 콤보와 상상 못 하는 기묘한 콤보까지 다 가능하게 되었다. 격투게임의 가장 큰 재미중 하나인 콤보 익히기가 아주 즐겁다.

근데 넷플은 구림.

게임의 밸런스도 크게 나쁘지는 않은 편이다. 캐릭터와 스타일을 다 합치면 93개나 되니까 모두 평등하게 만드는 건 불가능 하지만, 유일신 히메와 절대신 로어, 개그캐인 네코류를 제외하면 전부 비벼볼 수 있는 등급의 캐릭터라서 대전할 맛이 난다. 넷플로 대전은 못 해도 말이다.


단점은 오래 된 게임이나 보니까 도트가 튀는게 눈에 보일 정도라는 거. 밸런스가 좋다고 바로 위에 적었지만, 그 예외인 절대신과 유일신이 존재한다는 거. 그리고 넷플이 구리다는 것 정도가 있다.

33145456.review:
給點信仰正評，只求月姬與Fate系列相關作品上Steam。

談談遊戲優缺－－

遊戲性:
整體上遊戲性十分足夠，
有夠多的連段技巧與防禦手段，同時注重空戰打法。
除了最高難度與最高傷害設定下劇情模式最後boss有時真的會想砸機。

平衡上有小缺失，但是有足夠的相剋性可以稍微彌補這點。

劇情成分十分到位，特別是接觸過月姬、空之境界或是型月相關設定的玩家會倍感著迷。
但是如果在這之前沒有接觸過的話就是看電波有沒有吻合閣下的頻率了。
(換言之不是每個人都會沉浸在那繁多的設定之中)

論連線來說:
整體上與好基友連線還算方便，開個房邀個人就可以了，
但是在線上多人的情況下你很多時候不是會有延遲的狀況就是會遇不到人，
而有時排到人還會有實力差距過大的情況。

以畫質來說就是多年前街機等級，而且就算移植在pc上畫質仍然沒有多大進步。
優化尚可但是貌似本體是由PS2所移植所以還是有狀況發生。(例如跳窗開網頁，遊戲就會停止回應)

整體上仍然十分推薦死忠粉絲與新玩家遊玩，不過建議在特價時入手便是。
(不然這麼多年的遊戲還賣這個價錢......)

33093569.review:
To be fair I already played this game for quite some time 10 or so years ago so I may have a nostalgic/unbiased opinion on this game.
Anyway the key elements of this game are unique and complex mechanics, combat fairness, strangely unique background music and Type-Moon characters/lore.

Game's graphics are old and cheap, even if well animated, but that's not why you're buying this game, since that would be mechanics.
The game is definitely not user friendly: there's no proper tutorial, the combat system is cryptic and because of its own complexity I cannot recommend this game to casual players (unless you're playing with friends, casual players too). On the other hand if you're willing to study and learn from [b]external[/b] resources things like moon stances, bnb (bread'n'butter in fighting game slang) and general attack strings of all characters, frame times, etc you will enjoy the deepness of Melty Blood combat system and the game as a whole.

Melty Blood is one of the best fighting games (thinking eSport wise) of the past decade(s) and in my opinion should be on any fighting game enthusiast's library.

TL;DR: You're buying this game because of its great/complex combat system and because of Type-Moon, not really targeted to casual players (read above for further explanations).

32791164.review:
[I play many fighting games, but dont have the dedication or memory to be competative at any.]
[Reviewed with a Hori RAP4 stick modded with 8-way gate]

The game does many things that I would love to see in more fighting games, but needs little more polish to be great:

The menu screen reminds me of PS1-era games and is silent.  Not bad on it's own, but clashes with the rest of the game.
The character sprites looks great and the animation is good, but I have trouble visually telling some characters apart.
The sounds and music need to be normalized. Some characters like Mech pierce my ears while others are dull.  The same with the music; Great tracks (minus the off-rythym xylophone in the intro), but while some sound crisp, others (like the segue to the battle) sound like they went through a low-pass filter.
For some reason I really struggle pulling off dragon-punch (F-D-F) moves and many move altogether feel less responsive than I'd like.  Other moves dont feel reliable.  I havent dared to bring this online.  Ciel doesn't feel right at all.

Starting to get a bit negative, so I'll end with the parts I love:
The style customization is great idea for people like me that are terrible keeping up combos.
Great use of side banners with portraits and command lists. (but some are not listed?)
Anime styled but doesn't offend with over-the-top cliches or blatent fan-service. 
The option screen filters change realtime to choose the best look quickly.

All-in-all it might become a regular on the fight-night list, but I would not feel that I won or lost due to skill.


[Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code Hologram Summer Again, Tri Hermes Black Land....is this satire on titles or do you have no fucking idea what you are saying?]

中学～高校時代にハマってて実に10年来に懐かしくなってサマーセールで購入。
尚、同人版の時点で全年齢なので初代とＲｅＡｃｔを同人ショップで探した思い出を思い出し今は消えた日本橋のまんだらけに思いをはせる今や20代後半の夏。

ゲーム自体の細かいレビューはすでに他の人が書いてる通りの内容です。

格ゲーが苦手な自分でもコンボゲーである本作のコンボが実戦で繋がるほどに入力の猶予もあり、久しぶりながら手になじむように動かせました。
対人戦もゲームスピードの割に（初心者から見て）理不尽に中段やめくりがひっきりなしに飛んできまくるようなこともなく、下段ガード中心に防げばある程度は立ちまわれます。


ここからはやはり問題のラグ。やっぱりラグいです。
ランクマもカスタムで通信強度が2以上でないとまともな試合になりません。
自分はゲーム内の設定を解像度を640x480(ALLNET版以外のアーケード相当)、
ライブラリのゲーム名右クリックの設定からスチームオーバーレイ無効にして
ステージ選択権がある場合は遠野邸ロビーで固定。
これでラウンド１の掛け合い後コール中にfpsが60に復帰して快適な試合になることが増えました。

いまさらではありますが解像度設定とかなしでも快適になるように改善してほしいです…
通信強度設定のせいでほとんど一部の同じ人としか当たらない…

After cutting a chair into dozens of pieces (but not before saying 'this chair' a couple of a dozen times) the next thing I did was realize how stupid that was and got a new chair to sit on and then play this game. If you haven't gotten it by now from the sentence before this, I'm an avid fan of Tsukihime and Type Moon works in general. So, I do my best to jump at their works, head first, without looking if it's a hay stack or a pile of used syringe needles beside an AIDS patients hospital. However, I'm happy to say that I wasn't disappointed with this game at all.

The characters I know and love from Tsukihime are all in here. Albeit some of them act different (with some being ridiculously strong compared to how I remember them in the visual novel) I'm happy to see all of them again and in a fighting game.The moves aren't very complex so the barrier to entry for new players isn't very high, but they're hard to master so there's fun to be had in trying combinations out. The characters have a vast array of moves, and each character plays very differently from each other. Not one character feels too OP too. The art style chose is faithful to the type moon style and looks very beautiful and very refreshing when compared to other fighting games in this modern age.

31713293.review:
It's like the SSB Melee of fighting games. 10 years old and people are still playing it to this day.

Seriously though it is pretty good. Fast paced and easy to pick up and play.

You don't have to be a fighting game master to learn how to play Melty Blood if you know the basics. Charge up your magic gauge, do a quarter circle + C for a special, and beat 'em up with your expert combos.

[h1]Okay, so what the heck is it REALLY?[/h1]
Melty Blood is a fighting game like any other, but with some unique elements that make it stand out from the rest.

As you can probably tell by reading the description, there's 31 characters to choose from (Or you can cheat and play as the boss) and 3 styles for each character.

Some unique elements that separate it from the other fighting games:
- Styles change how your characters play, Cresent Moon is high speed and low attack for comboing, Half Moon is easy modo, and Full Moon is high attack and low speed.
- EX Sheilding, which allows you to counter an attack by pressing D at the right time or perfect shield it.
- Dedicated dash button if you play on a controller.
- Charge up your special gauge (known as the Magic Circuit in MB) if you pick Full Moon Style
- specials are pretty simple to execute
- 30 or so palettes for each character

[h1]Cons?[/h1]
- It's has the same 480p resolution that it had 10 years ago, but at least now it has command tips on the side of the screen.
- Some stages STILL aren't playable in Multiplayer, but there's a mod that enables them.
- Online is dead in the water, you're better off finding someone on the MB discord to play you instead of random matchmaking.
- The ranking screen kinda sucks

31433363.review:
PROS:
- Very well-polished gameplay and controls
- Large variety of characters and fighting styles
- Great arcade/story mode scenarios for each character
- Beautiful character designs and fluid sprite animation
- Brilliant soundtrack and voice-acting (RIP, Miyu Matsuki)

CONS:
- Those unfamiliar with Tsukihime will miss out on some story mode references
- If you are a beginner, good luck getting a single win in rank match
- Still no new Melty Blood, Tsukihime 2 or Tsukihime Remake

More than a decade after the release of the first Melty Blood, this japanese cult classic still delivers enough fast-paced excitement to put most modern fighters to shame. I definitely recommend this game to all Type-Moon fans, young and old. The amount of character development, world building and fanservice is simply breathtaking.

I also highly recommend it to fighting game players who enjoy fast-paced gameplay, interesting guarding/combo mechanics and well-balanced characters. Melty Blood is a rare gem that no fighting game enthusiast should miss.

Of course one of the newer games I'm compairing it to is a game that was supposed to be the HD sequel for Melty Blood. Under Night In-Brith started as an HD Melty Blood Game, which was to be released with the re-release of Tsukihime, the story Melty Blood is based on.

If you enjoy fighting games and havn't given it a try, then you need to. This game made it's mark on 2d fighter histroy. And its fans are awaiting the possibly HD Melty Blood which may be released with the Tsukihime remake that is apparently still being made.

But yeah... give it a try. I think you'll like it.

28915939.review:
気軽に対戦する分には、通常技のキャンセルルートが自由な為、特にストレスなくコンボが可能でしょう。
おしゃれなコンボをしようとすると、途端に難易度があがります。

キャラクター選択画面で表示されているキャラクターには、各3つのタイプがあります。
それぞれ同じ見た目のキャラクターでも、タイプを変えることによって得手不得手が変わります。
よって、好きなキャラであのキャラに勝てないという状況を減らしてくれます。

このタイトルで残念だったのは、ネット対戦が他タイトルよりも粗悪なことです。
それは相手のネット環境及び、PC環境の悪さが顕著にラグとして現れます。
よってランクマッチはおすすめできません。フレンド間の対戦でも不思議なラグと戦うことになるでしょう。
ストレス無く対戦するためには、ある程度のネットワーク知識が必要になり、プレイヤーへ余計な負担を強いるでしょう。

アーケードモード、トレーニングモード、ローカル対戦は最高のゲームです。

28124727.review:
It's probably the most overlooked and under-appreciated fighting game on Steam. Sure, it doesn't have all the bright colors, flashy bits and screen-filling smoke effects that newer fighting games like Guity Gear Xrd and BlazBlue possess but still it's skill based, balanced and extremely fun.

There are 31 fighters - each with their own unique fighting styles/moves to make them stand out from one another. Characters range from teenage vampires to cute kittens to tag-team maidens who just don't care! Experience a deep lore for all of them in story mood where the boss may change based on the character you choose.

What to expect?
* Anime characters in a dark world
* 2D Sprites with super-fluid movement
* Fast but strategic gameplay
* Backgrounds that don't seem to have moving parts, people or interaction
* Not that many players to fight online but the few that are remain devouted.
* Boss varies for each character which changes things up
* You can charge up like Dragon Ball Z

If there is one thing wrong with the game, it would be the online latency. I did notice some issues with lag and disconnects from time to time. Also, there are a lack of modes in this game compared to other games but the accuracy of perfect hitbox detection and versatility help make up for these things in this skill-based fighter.

I'm sure Melty Blood will always a special place in my heart, I'm quite happy I picked it up on a whim and quite surprised at just how fun it is.

[B]Also important to note: This game is a love letter to fans of: Type-Moon, Tsukihime and Kagetsu Tohya characters. [/b]

Amistoso con los noobs pero tambien con los pro,fácil de entender, difícil de dominar, con una historia bastante interesante (nada de torneo X porque estamos aburridos, es un ancestro muerto derivado de una leyenda muy peligroso lo que amenaza al pueblo) Los diseños de los personajes pueden parecer simples, pero son muy carismáticos. Hay variedad de movimientos y estilos de juego incluso en un mismo personaje, y cada uno tiene su historia (o historias, Mecha-Hisui tiene como tres), la forma de juego es bastante dinámica, me gustó Full Moon porque soy de madera para los combos :O . Lo mejor de todo: ARCUEID, en todas sus versiones, es badass como personaje narrado y como personaje jugable. Lo peor:SACCHIN (que dura que es para manejarla, ni un proyectil además) Bueno, la música a veces resulta un poco inconexa o aburrida, pero esta bien en general, acompaña. Y la parte gráfica, puede que esté un poco desactualizado, los sprites estan muy bien aunque son Low Definition,los fondos son bonitos, pero me gustaría un poco más de movimiento, (no viejitos ni esas cosas, se entiende que estan luchando en una ciudad de noche, o lugares poco frecuentados, pero al menos un vientito) Yo recomiendo altamente comprarlo, aunque el precio es un poco alto en comparación a KOF XIII o Blazblue, que son más HD y juegos impecables tambien, aprovechen mejor cuando esté de oferta, pero no dejen de comprarlo!

27413872.review:
Been playing this game across 5 different iterations and nearly 15 years before this review.

This game is worth every bit of money you spend on it no matter if you get it on sale or not. If you are a fan of fighting games such as Street Fighter and Soul Calibur then you will greatly appreciate adding this game to your library.
The different iterations have only ever improved the fluidity of the game. By now, Melty Blood has received the most polish I have seen on any fighting game:
The skill cap is immensly high with counters and parries being a regular part of high-end tactics.
There are a massive number of characters to play from for a game created by a fan-made studio that through sheer tenacity and hard work became an officially part of the story.
The new fighting stance feature caters to people who want to shake up the same-old playstyle from a decade ago and also helps newcomers come into the scene with a fighting chance.
A working Network Play feature that doesn't use an external program this time.
An online ranking system.
And tons more that you should just see for yourself.

10/10 - I'm just glad this game finally made it to worldwide audiences so I can properly support it

26864857.review:
ネット対戦に関しては多くの方が書いているため割愛。

個人的には一番ハマったであろう格闘ゲーム。

[h1] ◆良い点[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]魅力的なキャラクター達[/b]
今作は現在アニメ化やゲーム化など幅広く商品展開している[u] Fate[/u]シリーズを作ったTYPE-MOON(俗に言う型月)の前身作品、[u] 月姫[/u]を原作とした格闘ゲームだ。
またゲストキャラクターとして同会社の作品「空の境界」から両儀式が参戦しているのも見所のひとつ。
TYPE-MOON作品にはファンが多く、この辺りは他の方が熱くレビューされているのでそちらを参考にしていただきたい。

    [*][b]空中制御の豊富さ[/b]
対戦シーンを見た事のある人は分かると思うが、他の格闘ゲームと比べるととにかく空中にいる事が多い。
二段ジャンプや空中ダッシュを駆使してスピーディな空中戦を楽しむのはとても気持ちが良い。
勿論それなりのリスクも存在していて、空中カウンターをすると空中受身が取れなくなり相手に大ダメージコンボを貰ってしまう事もある。
しかしそれは逆に自分のリターンになり得るもので、相手が空中のどこに居るかを見極めながらそれに適した技を当てて行くと自分もそのシステムの恩恵にあずかれるのだ。
この駆け引きがとても楽しく、爽快なものとなっている。

    [*][b]逆転要素の存在[/b]
他の格闘ゲームの多くはダメージを与えられると回復する事が出来ないものが多いが、このゲームには存在する。（勿論存在するゲームもある）
完全無敵で相手を吹き飛ばす事の出来る強制解放というシステムがあり、これを使うと一定時間体力が回復していくようになる。
このシステムのおかげで残り体力が少なく、窮地に陥ったという場面でも相手を吹き飛ばしながら回復する事ができ、逆転の可能性が高まるのだ。

    [*][b]コンボの簡単さ[/b]
このゲームのチェーンコンボはとても自由度の高いものとなっている。
例えばしゃがみ大攻撃から立ち小攻撃にチェーンを戻したり、小攻撃からいきなり大攻撃に繋げることもできる。
最初は取っ付き難いかもしれないが、慣れると人それぞれに色んな繋ぎ方を考える事のできる奥深いシステムだ。
また、このシステムのおかげでキャラクター目当てで始めた人でも適当にポチポチとボタン押しているだけでサクサクとコンボ繋がり、格闘ゲーム初心者でも楽しめる要素になっている。
[/list]

[h1] ◆悪い点[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]一人用モードの少なさ[/b]
今作のSteam版には、コンシューマー版に搭載されていたサバイバル、ボスラッシュ、ギャラリーなどのモードが削られている。
そのためネット対戦はせずに一人だけで色んなモードで楽しみたい！という人は物足りなく感じるかと思われる。
どうにかしてこれらを収録出来なかったのだろうか。

    [*][b]グラフィックの荒さ[/b]
このゲームの初出は2002年だが、キャラクターのドット絵が現在まで十年以上使いまわされてる。
キャラゲーの側面も持っているのにこの荒さは致命的なのではなかろうか…。
いつ出るかは分からないがリメイクに期待したいところ。

    [*][b]ひと試合の冗長さ[/b]
上記した強制解放というシステムは体力が回復するというメリットがあるが、それ故に決着が付きづらく試合が長くなる事が多い。
強制解放を行うとタイムが止まる、というのもそれに拍車をかけている。

    [*][b]コンボの長さ・複雑さ[/b]
上にはコンボが簡単！と書いてるのに矛盾してない？と思う方もいるかもしれないが、コンボが簡単なのはあくまで初心者用のものだけに留まっている。
対戦で上を目指そうとすると途端にコンボが長く、複雑になってゆく。
コンボが長いと相手に喰らっているあいだ受け身を取るためにボタンをポチポチと押し続けるハメになってしまう。
コンボ練習が好きな人や、難しいコンボを決めることにやり応えを感じるという人なら逆に良い点となりうるかもしれない。

    [*][b]キャラバランスの悪さ[/b]
各キャラクターごとにクレセント・ハーフ・フルと3つのスタイルを選ぶことができ、同じキャラクターでも全く異なった戦いが出来る。
…といえば聞こえが良いが、多くの戦い方ができるが故にバランスを取りきれてない面も存在する。
同じキャラクターでも他二つのスタイルが弱く、実質一つのスタイルしか選択肢にない場合が存在したり、一部のキャラクターの一つのスタイルが全キャラクターの中でも突出して強力だったりする場合もある。
バランスを完璧に取れたなら良いシステムになり得ただろうが、格闘ゲームという緻密な調整が必要なゲームでそれは限りなく不可能に近いことであろう…。
[/list]

[h1]◆格闘ゲームファンに向けて[/h1]
ゲーム性が他とは大きく異なり、好みが分かれるかもしれない。
しかし気が向いたときでもいいので一度は触れてみる価値があると断言する。
空中戦がメインなので最初はどうすればいいのか分からない人もいるかもしれないが、最初は恥ずかしがらずにぴょんぴょんと飛んでみよう。
ハマってしまえば他のゲームの地上戦とは異なった空中での差し合いの楽しさにやみつきになるはずだ。

[h1]◆型月・原作ファンに向けて[/h1]
ファンならば大いに楽しめる事うけあい。
やはり自分の好きなキャラを好きなように動かすのは楽しいのだ。
少しステップアップして格好いいコンボができるようになったときの感動もひとしお。
そして買えばきのこを月姫リメイク製作に奮起させる可能性がある…かもしれない。
…………かもしれない。

26797208.review: Когда-то тайп был годным, в те времена из под руки Киноко Насу и Такаши Такеучи вышли такие проекты как Tsukihime, Fate / Stay Night и Kara no Kyoukai. "Талая кровь" представляет собой додзинси-файтинг по визуальной новелле "Повесть о лунной принцессе" и это тот файтинг в который мне до сих пор приятно играть. Да, ужасная графика, фиговые спрайты, огромная куча разноцветных баб как персонажей. Но не смотря на все недостатки ему все равно удалось зацепить меня. Быть может дело в проработанной вселенной с хорошей атмосферой, интересных персонажах оригильной новеллы, а быть может в очень простом, даже интуитивном, но все равно занимательном и веселящем геймплее (плюс ко всему в последней части нам дают аж три стиля игры за каждого персонажа) - не знаю. Но факт, остается фактом - Melty Blood мой личный фаворит среди файтингов. Ну и да, рецензия куплена, ибо мне просто нужен значок с осенней распродажи 2016.

26553395.review:
知る人ぞ知る同人格闘ゲーム、クイーンオブハート
シリーズ(QOH)の、正統後継。

QOHシリーズと違い、全員が空中ダッシュを持つも
のとなっている。
ディレイの調節により、芹香やコモードのような超
絶低空ダッシュコンボこそできないが、これにより
「大空中戦時代」に突入した作品となっている
(これには賛否両論がある)。

全キャラクターが、3種類のムーンスタイルを持ち、
キャラクターひとりでいろいろ楽しめるものとなっ
ている事も、本作の重要な特徴となる。

中にはQOHのキャラの後継となる技構成を持つキャ
ラクターもいる。
しかし、QOHと同じ必殺技となるのはフルムーンス
タイルなのだが、フルムーンスタイルでは通常技キ
ャンセルのつながりが悪いため、ＱＯＨばりのコン
ボの自由さが楽しめないため、通常技のコンボを楽
しみたければ、クレセントをおすすめする。

なつかしきQOHをしのばせるキャラクターも複数お
り、QOHが好きな方のために、ご紹介させていただく
事にする。

・ティリア
　　蒼崎青子、というキャラクターがティリアの後継
　　キャラとなる。
　　大会使用禁止キャラとなっていた性能が、ほどよ
　　くなり、普通に使用できるようになった事はうれ
　　しい限りである。
　　あの猛烈に強いジャンプ強攻撃こそ弱体化したも
　　のの、上位ランクキャラとしての立場は健在であ
　　る。

・柏木千鶴
　　制服を着ていない秋葉というキャラクターが、ち
　　ーちゃんの後継キャラとなる。
　　EX切り裂き(昇竜コマンド)からの追い打ちコンボは
　　今回も健在であり、今回は技が終了したらすぐに、
　　エリアルに移行できるものとなっており(着地して
　　からまた飛ぶわけではない)、QOHと比べ自由度が
　　高まっている。
　　鬼の爪はリーチがかなり短くなったものの、空中
　　可となり、低空技としてのかため技に変化。
　　猛威を振るったダッシュ中は、通常中攻撃連打で
　　出るが、当時ほど強くはない。

・柏木梓
　　軋間紅摩が後継。
　　打撃投げであった剛力が、完全に投げ技となり、
　　これにより、投げてからの起き攻めが強力な、
　　純然たる投げキャラとなった。
　　鬼の拳は、スタイルによってはノーゲージ高火
　　力技となっている。
　　昇竜もあるが、フルの場合はつかみ技となって
　　おり、通常の昇竜はクレセントが持つものとな
　　る。

・柏木楓
　　翡翠＆琥珀が後継。
　　QOHほどダメージが高くないが、ちゃんとタン
　　デムアタックに「似た」技もある。
　　QOHで使い勝手の悪かったオラオラが、エリア
　　ルへ移行する派生技が追加され強化されている。
　　それぞれを単体で使う事もでき、翡翠は波動昇
　　竜キャラに、そして、琥珀はリーチキャラとな
　　っている。

・太田香奈子
　　ヒロインでもない脇役に、まさかの引継ぎキャ
　　ラが存在。
　　弓塚というキャラである(通称さっちん)。
　　４１２３６＋大の超必は同様の性能を持つ技が
　　健在(最後に倒れ込むところも同じ)であり、消
　　火器こそ持たないが、各必殺技も同じである。
　　あの猛烈なハイパーアーマーこそなくなったが、
　　かわりに扱いやすくなっているといえる。


目立つものはこんな感じとなる。
キーボード派のQOHファンとしては、steam版とな
りキーボードでできるようになった事が、感涙もの
といえる。

24753433.review:
I never thought I'd give this game a thumbs down, considering it is one of my favorite fighting games of all time, but I cannot recommend it in its current state. Pro-tip: don't release a game until you fix the reason most people are buying it.
何年間待ってたのに、ネットプレイが酷すぎて、大ファンとしてがっかりです。

Why do I prefer this fighting game over others? I love how it feels as a fighter. The characters have lots of mobility and many options at their disposal. The sprites are low res, but beautifully animated with aesthetically pleasing keyframe poses, movement speeds, gravity, weight, etc. Tons of characters with completely different variations, as well as multiple playing styles for each. A plethora of great music tracks, stages, etc, etc.

The problem is, I bought this version for its netplay, which has turned out to be... lacking, to say the least. If I'd known the netplay would be this bad, I would have stuck with the version compatible with fan-made Caster/Rollback support.

I waited YEARS for this to get a proper release, and as I feared and expected, this is the sad result. I held out on a refund in the hopes that they'd soon announce Caster/Rollback support, to no avail. Now it's too late to get a refund.

So, I guess... if you like fighters for their gameplay, I highly recommend this. If you like fighters for playing with others (I'm pretty sure most fighting game fans fall into this category), then I cannot recommend this. Not because it's a bad game, because it is most definitely not a bad game. It just fails hard where it likely matters most.

I'd hoped this version would give this game the attention it deserves, and foster a healthy online community. Unfortunately, the poor netplay support (or lack of) has once again sealed its fate, damning it to a dark, dank corner. 

Even if they were to fix the netplay now, it's very likely to be far, far too late. But you can assume this review to become "recommended" if they ever do fix it. Some day.

24716598.review:
Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code is one of, if not THE best fast-paced anime fighting game on the market. Being the perfected form of the now aged Melty Blood series, AACC adds new mechanics and near seamless play that only gets more fun as you improve. If you have no idea what I'm talking about when I say "Melty Blood series," it's fine and actually one of the very few issues with the game. This game caters greatly to fans of the visual novel Tsukihime and the Melty Blood fighting game series associated with it. The issue with this however is the fact that neither Tsukihime nor the Melty Blood games have been officially released outside of Japan, making this a sort of super-niche game. The game's story mode is based heavily on the events of previous titles, though some are just comedic plotlines to fill up arcade modes for each character. The real meat of the game is in its rich and complex gameplay. The movements and combinations are very smooth and don't take crazy skill to do most of the time. The wide variety of characters adds great depth to the game, and since most characters are viable you can pick your favorite and go far.

Overall, this game is a wonderful present from TYPE-MOON to its international fans, and as such really shines brightest when you have a history with the Tsukihime franchise. If you're just looking for a lightning-fast, high-skill fighting game with some interesting anime characters, I couldn't recommend this game enough.

24521255.review:
Type Moon stuff available on Steam = Win

That was my initial thought when I first heard of that release a few months ago.

But the main question for other users should be: Is this title just a game for hardcore otakus or fans of the Tsukihime and Melty Blood franchise, or is it worth a try for people who has no idea about that Type Moon stuff?

Compared to most other 2D/3D Beat 'em up titles, Melty Blood feels kinda unique and like a true peace of art. Maybe because the market is filled with uninspired sequels for the shelfes. So this is a real unique selling position in my opinion, which is urgently needed, because Beat 'em up games are facing a decreasing market. Just think of the last Street Fighter V game, which was a big disappointment for Capcom and the players as well. Only the last Tekken Title was a great success due to a clever viral marketing.

So what about Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code?

First of all you got to know this is a PS2 port that was originally released in 2011. But it´s really a good port of the game. So you can expect a classic "back to the roots" fighting game with a challenging and complex fight mechanism. Further more it has a huge amount of playable characters with 3 different fighting styles each. I can highly recommend to read the various guides on the MB (Melty Blood) community page, to get a clue how to master the controlls. To describe it´s difficulty: Well let´s say it´s easy to learn, but hard to master.
So it´s not as difficult as the Virtua Fighter Games, where you have to spend many ingame hours to gain a small success. Only if you really intend to mess with the real pros out there, you (and me too) definitely have to spend some playtime in it. But this point leads to the main negative point of the game. Because you can´t compete with other dudes online, in the current game version. I´ve tryed to login a network session one time, and it don´t work for me. But you can read a lot of complaints about this topic on the review site of the game. So if you intend to enjoy a few online fights, you have to wait till this issue get fixed by the developers.
But everthing else like the visual novel storytelling, the smooth animations and the complex fighting mechanism makes this title worth a try for everyone who is searching for a classic "back to the roots" fighting game. 

Pros
- Type Moon
- Shiki Ryôgi
- Various characters with 3 different fighting styles
- Easy to learn
- Challenging and complex fighting system, where you can spend hours to master your favourite character

Cons
- Network issue really sucks
- training mode should have some controll advises, so you could learn more effective

So give it a try, you definitly won´t regret it. At least it´s only 22 EUR that you have to spend.

24290178.review:
Fantastic port, hard and devoted community that struggled hard to keep the fighting game they love alive and made a religion out of, and over all a damn good fighting game to say the least.
Actress Again Current Code is the final chapter in the long running Melty Blood series of fighting games spun off a slightly bigger franshise of various games apparently including an adult visual novel that is the heart of how this game came to be. 
Melty Blood is a fast paced 2D fighting game with anime inspired visuals and a numerous number of styles or "grooves" as a call them since they give reminder of the groove system from Capcom VS SNK 2, a game I am also quite fond of and hope could maybe make it here one day. There are three style based on moon phases that change your character in some cases in subtle ways and in others massively and some say this adds a lot of difficulty. Speaking as someone who has not been playing this game for neigh 10 years like some even while following it for a while I can say that difficulty or not there is just something really fun that clicks with me very well about this game. It is one of the few 5 button fighters like Guilty Gear but even preferring GG's style and characters I find Melty Blood to be way more enjoyable and probably the easier of the two to get into. It's nice to see after years of community effort and fan translation we finally have an official port here on Steam for languages other than Japanese. 

I just really enjoy this game and can't recommend it enough.

このゲームはたくさんの問題を抱えています。ランクマッチ戦のポイントがおかしかったり、対戦時に1P側がシオンを即選ぶとハングしたり(2P側だとVシオン)、スチームの設定のオーバーレイを切らないと徐々に重くなったり、プレイヤーのできうる万全の状態で対戦を行っても突然ラグが発生することがあったり　等です。
ですが、カーニバルファンタズム版(CP版)と比べると値段が非常に安いこと、対戦以外のモードは快適であること、対戦においても回線の制限さえかければ思いもよらぬラグが発生しない限りはある程度快適に遊べること、改善速度は遅いですがラグやバグの改善に取り組む姿勢を見せていること、以上を考慮しておすすめとさせて頂きました。
特に、このゲームをやったことないけどある程度キャラを動かせる様になるまでやってみたいという人には、ゲーセンではできない　トレーニングモード、プレマによる初心者対戦（初心者詐欺多いですが・・・）　等といった幅広い練習方法を試せるため、結果的にゲーセンやCP版よりもコスパがよくなると思うのでお勧めです。
逆に、ほんのちょっとのラグも寛容できない！という人にはお勧めできません。

23982730.review:
What many people may not know is the Type-Moon, the creators of Fate/Zero and Fate/Stay Night, have another amazing IP:
[b]Tsukihime.[/b] 
The story about a boy that slices up a vampire and then preceeds to bang said vampire. Also somethings about the mystic eyes of death, [spoiler]Shiki being an imposter[/spoiler], Vampire queens, and all that other stuff. Don't worry about it.

Well, Melty Blood just happens to be a story set after the events of Tsukihime and god is it a great story to invest yourself into. (Also, helps a lot with watching Carnival Phantasm seeing as half the cast in that is from Tsukihime)

Now, the game plays pretty good for a port from the PS2. There's a few things that can be desired from the controls, and maybe a bit of character scaling, but on a whole, it's a great port. The graphics have been cleaned up. Everything's looking nice a sharp. The game performs fantastically. On a whole, they did well. Also it's in English (except the voices). Makes it a but load easier to play and get invested in the story.

The game is fairly hard to get good at, especially if you haven't played this sort of game genre before. Also fairly hard if you're like me and you played the Japanese version where select and back are reversed haha... But a few characters are worse fights than others. While playing the story mode, I'd dread meeting up with "Ciel" as there'd be a very troubling and arduous fight ahead of me because she's both strong in close and long range with very fast attacks, nailing down your HP in seconds. Then there's the problems with the final arcade mode boss for each character... It seems to be more up to chance than it is up to skill and up to you learning the boss's attack pattern before you're able to take them down. Also, you rarely know what's hitting you as the whole screen seems to be the hitbox... (Also, there's being corner guarded... Stay far away from the corners kids =))
Apart from that, the rest of the characters are pretty well balanced and fun to play and fight against. As you play the game, your skills will rise but you'll most likely never have an easy time with the computer. While not being hard at all points in time, they don't make it easy for which is good. It incourages you to be on your toes at all points in time.
On a whole, this is a pretty good fighting game with some good challenges and not many unfair situations that you can find yourself in.

Anyway, if you're looking for a good fighting game and a good story, then look no further! This is the first fighting game that I was willing to buy and steam and boy was it a good choice.

23955022.review:
I first discovered Melty Blood from some random MUGEN video on YouTube and was surprised to see fighting game characters I was unfamiliar with, so I "acquired" Melty Blood Re-ACT Final Tuned, played story mode, started playing it with friends via a netplay client some fans made.  This continued with Melty Blood Act Cadenza (although they took out story mode and never brought it back, which is kinda disappointing).  In the Act Cadenza days, I got really, REALLY good at the game.  Then Actress Again came to PS2 in Japan, and I had to wait for what felt like ages for the PC version to be released (because pirates).  Now, about ten years after the initial PC release, the PC version's finally available outside Japan, thanks to Arc System Works, and I finally have a legitimate copy of Melty Blood.  Yay!

Melty Blood is a fun fighting game that's actually pretty easy to get into.  Given, you'll run into a lot of people who've been playing it for over a decade, such as myself, but it's not that hard to learn.  The combo system in this game is pretty simplistic.  Chain combos which usually begin with mashing A or 2A, then going through the other buttons in a sequence that doesn't use the same attack twice (you can mix things up a lot with command normals here), juggle an enemy after a sweep and convert that into an air combo with two normals, a jump cancel, another two normals and a special move or a throw if you want a hard knockdown.

As with all fighting games, just find a character you like, spend enough time in training/arcade mode before you go online and you'll be fine.  You'll still lose here and there, but there are things you can only learn from fighting human opponents.  My only complaint is that they fixed the bunker cancel glitch from MBAC that allowed for bara cancels, but I guess that's okay, they were pretty broken (especially where I was concerned, 'cuz I'd more or less mastered them).  Although I do wish the game would have come to Steam so much sooner, I'm happy it got here at all.

There is no tutorial, but there is a command list, which lists (almost?) every move in the game.  They even put Kohaku's Drug On Install (I'm still going to call it that, no matter what the game or translation patch decides to call it) in the command list, so it's not a secret move anymore, which I kinda have mixed feelings about.  I like it when a fighting game has secrets 'cuz I grew up when we didn't have command lists and had to figure things out through button mashing or trial and error, but that's just me being an old fart fighting gamer (I think we prefer the term legacy fighting gamer).

Either way, while the game doesn't really look that interesting graphically ('cuz it's a PS2 era fighting game [think Capcom VS SNK 2 without teams and true love making]), you'd be surprised with how deep and engaging it really is, and it's still well worth playing to this very day.  In fact, similarly to the groove system from CVS2, the moon phase fighting styles change the mechanics of the game in ways that are both subtle and not so subtle.  I only recently discovered that full moon even lets you use heat activations as roman cancels to extend your combos.  I just use crescent moon most of the time, since it's the mechanics and fighting styles from previous games that I'm used to, but now I wanna try using full moon more.

Anyhow, I think I've gushed enough.  TL;DR: Get this game.  Game's fun, and it's been pirated long enough.  Time to shell out some money to the devs and publisher for finally bringing it to the west.  Took their asses long enough.

23392691.review:
*EDIT AS OF 03-20-2017*
     As something worth mentioning, the netcode has been VASTLY improved as of the current edit, and is actually freaking playable now with little input lag. It took about eight months after the game came out (December patch had it included, I believe), but the game finally has netcode worth playing online over now. 

I remember about four years ago, Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code (for the rest of this review will be listed as MBAACC for convience's sake) was released on PC and included as a bonus for those who bought the third blu-ray set for "Carnival Phantasm". It so happened that a friend of mine at school somehow managed to pool together funds for the set and bought it, with the sole intention of installing the game on everyone's computers and fun was had for the last few months of our school life. I never thought that MBAACC would ever make it to the West, much less on something like Steam, so when I heard that it was releasing late April of 2016, I was ecstatic to say the least. Well, how well does the NA region version fare with the original packaged version? Well, continue reading to find out!

    For what started off as a spin-off doujin fighting game of Type-MOON's Visual Novel, Tsukhime, the series has certainly evolved and gotten better (not every character has an infinite combo any more, for example). The general story for the game typically involves the strange mist that has covered the town and changes people who enter it, but for each character, there are either slight changes to the story or it covers a character that is dead in the Tsukihime universe, such as Roa and Kouma Kishibe and for what purpose they are alive again. The story can be pretty nonesensical, even if you have knowledge of the game MBAACC is based off of, but it's certainly entertaining to say the least. My biggest qualm with it is that a lot of the references and character interactions will more than likely be lost on someone who has absolutely no knowledge of the game or its VN original, but with games like these, the story isn't exactly what you play it for. I'm also a little irked on how the translation for the game is; it commonly swaps between using the original Japanese honorifics (i.e, Kohaku sometimes referring to Akiha as "Akiha-sama" at time, but in other moments with the exact same line spoken in Japanese, it'll swap out to "Master Akiha".) Some the text also has some wierder choice of words for a coresponding situation, but alas, it's not too big of a deal in the big picture, I'm just very picky when it comes to translation quality and it shouldn't affect someone else's enjoyment.

    While the graphics aren't exactly the best for a port of an Arcade game, it certainly isn't the worst looking fighting game out there but it is definitely dated by today's standards. While the in-game graphics are okay, the character portraits look nice and can be fairly comical during the Win screens and Story Mode, which is a nice addition to any game, much less MBAACC. The music for the game is absolutely phenomenal, and Raito deserves all the praise he can get for creating one of the best fighting game soundtracks I've ever heard; It's right up there with Guilty Gear and Touhou HIsouten - Scarlet Weather Rhapsody as one of my favorite fighting game OSTs. MBAACC runs very smoothly, without any frame dip and is one of the most fluid fighting games I've ever played. Now, when you start up one of the various play modes, you'll probably notice once you pick a character it gives you an option for "Crescent Moon", Half Moon" or "Full Moon" playstyles. Each playstyle is unique and not only gives each character certain abilities (like Crescent Moon allowing for "Reverse Beat" hits and the ability to go into a frenzied "Blood Heat" mode with enough gauge and conditions fufillled, Half Moon giving more block priorities and Full Moon allowing you to CHARGE UP your Heat Gauge), they also change the move set for each character. Let's use the character Archetype;Earth, for example. With the CM playstyle, she has a ground projectile that faces its longer side away from the player to hit opponents in the front, but with the FM playstyle, said projectile changes direction when used and points itself towards the person using it, as to hit an opponent from behind. The playstyles in this game are what make MBAACC so unique compared to other fighters, and it's very fun to try out all of the various playstyles and see what works best for each player, as opposed to being locked into one moveset that may or may not be very efficient. Each character also has a shield skill that if timed right, can negate most opponent's attacks, give yourself gauge to use AGAINST them, and if you have Blood Heat active, can be turned into a devastating attack that deals massive ammounts of damage to your opponent. Think if Exdeath's "Omniblock" skill had an instant EX burst attached to it, and that's what shielding in this game can do.

   In closing, I love Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code to almost the fullest ammount I can, even with the issues I've stated before. I regard this game as much as I do Touhou Hisoutensoku (which is also a PHENOMINAL game), and it will forever be one of my favorite games of all time. Do I recommend this? As much as humanly possible. 

  Pros:
- Fluid mechanics
- "Moon" style makes every character feel like three different characters, giving added fun
- Amazing music
- Controls are very easy to learn, but hard to master
- Can use controller or keyboard to play, which is always lovely
- Large cast of characters

  Cons:
- Somewhat iffy translation
- The game has difficulty spikes in story mode that can really put off a player from playing
- Story mode can be confusing to people who have no knowledge of Tsukihime

I hope you all enjoy this game as much as I have!

This is a fighting game I always thought wouldn't come officially to the West. Thanks to Arc System Works though, they brought in one of my opinions, one of the most balanced fighting games around.

With over 30 characters and three different styles(Known as Moons) there is a lot of experimentation with who and how you play the game.

If there's one flaw I have to give this game though, it's the poor netcode which at least to me, has some lag online. Other than that, for people who enjoy Tsukihime or fighting games(or both) this is worth picking up.

やりきった中二病は
全てを超えて美しい───。


ベタ褒めします。キャラクターの性能バランスについてやマッチングの未熟さを踏まえつつ
それでもなお、他作品が霞むほどこのゲームが対戦格闘として大好きです。
特筆すべきは2点。ストーリーや設定は『月姫』のものなので別評価として、そこに登場する
キャラクター達の「再現度」が半端ないのです。この『Melty Blood』シリーズは。
『月姫』で「こうあればいいのに」と想像していた、殆どその通りに生き生きと動く
志貴やアルクェイド、シエル先輩をこの手で操作できる事そのものが、このゲーム最大の魅力でしょう。
……『月姫』を知っていれば。[spoiler] あとぶっちゃけ月姫じゃなくて地球姫だし。[/spoiler]

また、このゲームは音楽が秀逸です。Steamゲーの中でも一、二を争う世界観説明度ではないでしょうか。
旧作Act Cadenzaをプレイされた方は、"Through the Looking Glass" を聴きながら
夢の雪原を舞う白レン (White Ren) に心がパドゥーシャしたはずです。もちろんこのActress Againにも収録されています。

雰囲気とノリに流されて、キャラクターになりきって遊ぶ。
Melty Bloodは劇場であり、プレイヤーはActressでありAudienceなのです──。

23002882.review:
I had this game before it was out on Steam and loved it but due to the nature of that 'purchase' the online features were not working. I was so pleased to see that it has finally been released on Steam and I purchased it right away.
The game is amazing! If the anime appearance isn't your thing then try to look past it because there is tons of technical potential and the characters are all unique. Now lets put that unique character potential up by 3. Each character has 3 variations or styles that play significantly different which counts for endless hours of training mode. The pace is fast and intense with mixups and damage being extremely high depending on who you play. The music is great; some being funky club kind and others being operatic and epic for the battles.
I've heard the online isn't always great but I haven't used it yet and there's always room for updates and tweaks. If you have someone in your area to play with then I'm sure the connection shouldn't be too bad, if at all.
If you like fighting games then try Melty Blood. It's one of the best original fighters thats been around for a long time.

22953409.review:
＊＊＊良い点＊＊＊
価格に対してのボリュームは十分です。
キャラ数が多いので、ストーリーモードを一通り楽しむだけでも元は取れると思います。
ゲームシステム自体も初代からコツコツ積み重ねてきただけあり上手く纏まっていて、
いわゆるコンボゲーに属しますが、基礎コンならどのキャラも簡単なので初心者でも安心です。
全キャラ共に地上で殴って浮かせて空中で殴って投げで〆みたいな感じなのでアークの他作品と比べても簡単かも。
トレモも必要そうな機能は揃っているので問題ないでしょう。

＊＊＊悪い点＊＊＊
ネット対戦がちょっとどうかなぁ、と。
ちょこちょこバージョンアップされてますがネット対戦の環境はラグがある事があり、
酷い時には30F以上のラグが出るんで話になりません。
もう結構言われてますが、スペックや回線ではなくゲームか鯖自体に問題があると思われるので改善待ちです。
後は他の方のレビューにもありますが設定を下げる事である程度マシになるとは思います。
自分も相手も設定を最低まで落としてると快適に試合できる可能性が高いのかなぁ。

次にキャラバランス。
どこぞの串とか鳥みたいな有名なぶっ壊れとまではいきませんが一部のキャラの特定のスタイルはくっそ強いです。
相性もありますが正直下の方のキャラで相手してるとかなり辛いと思います。

と、一応格ゲーでは避けられない宿命なんで書きましたが結局プレイヤーの腕次第ですね。
むしろキャラ数多いのに加えてスタイル3つで通常技から変わってくるシステムという事を踏まえれば上出来な方かもしれません。

＊＊＊総評＊＊＊
おすすめで「はい」か「いいえ」なら「はい」です。
私みたいにトレモしてるだけでも楽しい人種にはキャラ数的にもオススメできます。
ネット対戦には今後の修正に期待するとして、それを除いても価格分の価値は十分あるでしょう。
メルブラ自体久々に触りましたがやっぱりメカヒスイは最高やな！

Pretty happy this made it onto Steam.
Been playing it for a LOOOOOOOONNNGGGGG long time and I've always loved the series along with Fate.
Hopefully some Fate games make into Steam soon.
Oh wait, this is a review, uhh... Awesome easy to pick up and play game with more depth than you'd initially think.
(Master Shield[Parry] and you'll feel like a baddass forever.)
It has aged rather well for having been originally released in 2009 on the PS2, the online play is pretty great as well, no hiccups at all in the time I've played.
Only issue I've had is I needed to force VSync through the NVidia Control Panel due to some screen tearing and no option for it in-game, this can be easily remedied though and it's still rather minor.
I definitely recommend this for both hardcore fans of fighting games or dirty casuals who wanna have some fun due to the "easy to learn, hard to master" gameplay style and quirky characters.

22778796.review:
The Good:
Amazing soundtrack, fast and tight gameplay. 
31 characters with 3 different variations/systems for each (think of grooves from CvS2).

Essentially there's a flexible, power and simple style which have their own unique mechanics and also
change a character's normal and special moves, making for different playstyles.

Extra story and a good deal of character specific intros / fight quotes for those of you who liked Tsukihime.
This game is really fun even if you didn't read Tsukihime (like me).
Devs have been good with patches and even included some QoL changes not in the original version.

The Bad:
(Delay-based) Netcode can be kinda wonky. Sometimes you'll play an entire multiplayer match in delay, like you're fighting in space or something. Devs are working on this, however.
Rather basic singleplayer experience. Arcade mode and training.

The Skinny: 
Not a good singleplayer experience unless you LOVE Tsukihime.
If you got a fighting game buddy to play this with, it's great. 
Also check out "Kore Wa... Melty Blood" steam group to look for fellow players.

22745808.review:
Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code is an amazing game, one of the best fighting games out there, and definately one of the best fighting games available on steam. While a few of the sprites might have aged a little bit, the visuals in this game are outstanding, and it has one of- if not the very best soundtrack in a fighting game, with many iconic tunes with a ton of variety. Definately purchase this.

Now, there are some negatives. These are mostly just small nitpicks, so bare with me. Now, from what I've heard of the netcode, it could definately be better, as I've heard of multiple cases of lag and disconnections. However, it seems these netcode problems are being patched as I'm writing this, so we'll see how it will turn out in the future. The second problem I have is a very minor one, but a problem nonetheless. When in training mode, there is a option to be able to reset the position of the characters at where you started. Most fighting games have this, but in this port things are a little different. In most other fighting games, the standard button for resetting positions are usually the select button, when playing on a stick or DS3 that is. However, when you set the button for training mode reset, the select button is the button for removing buttons, which forces you to use a different button. Also, when you do reset the positions, you reset the music as well, while it usually just continue from where it was in other games. These are VERY minor things, but I would really appreciate it if these problems could be fixed.

22744710.review:
Empecemos por lo inicial, el juego es una port del Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code de la Ps2 (desde la opinion de alguien que nunca ha jugado a un juego de lucha previamente) tiene unas mecanicas bastante duras si eres un novato en este genero a parte de no darte apenas informacion de tutorial o algo por el estilo; buscate la vida (hay guias en Steam y videos asi que no es mucho preoblema). Tras varias horas hasta acostubrarte comprendes que las dinamicas de combate, combos, parris y bloqueos son faciles de usar pero de una dificultad muy alta de dominar y usar a la perfección.Lo que lo hace relativamente asequible pero sobretodo extremadamente divertido. El modo de juego principal es el Arcade, no hay un modo historia principal como en MKX o en los anteriores Melty Blood, donde ocurrian batallas segun el guion, aqui simplemente esto se situa tras los Melty Blood anteriores (Melty Blood al fin y al cabo es un Spin-Off de la franquicia de Type-Moon Tsukihime,de paso de donde estan sacados la mayoria de personajes, Tsukihime era un juego novela visual con toques pornograficos hentai; si olvidemos el hecho de que este juego viene del PORNO de dibujos animados, ademas Tsukihime cuenta con un anime un tanto MEH y un grandioso manga/comic que si que deberias leer a minimo que te vaya interesar este juego (QUE COÑO LEELO ES BUENISIMO HAZTE UN FAVOR http://submanga.com/Lunar_Legend_Tsukihime/Prologo/29351 )) en fin dejando el contexto de Melty Blood la historia se puede resumir en hay un vampiro una noche en la ciudad que despierta los miedos internos y como tal aparecen sombras y clones del resto de personajes, y basicamente escojas el personaje que escojas debes partirles el pecho al resto hasta llegar a un final similar pero distinto y en algunos momentos abusrdo total. (Es muy divertido pero algo simplon a menos que vayas subiendo la dificultad como un animal). El juego tambien tiene una cantidad absurda de logros para entretenerte y que pases el rato con alguna partidita suelta. Luego en el juego queda el ultimo elemento: el online, que en mi opinion es bastante pobre debido a la falta de gente, y la poca que hay se reira de ti porque llevan jugando a este juego desde la Ps2 y se lo saben de memoria, por no hablar que la conexion va regular. Por lo demas el juego aunque algo simple graficamente es bonito sobretodo si te fijas en los sprites.
Podrias preguntarte ¿No seria mas rentable coger otro juego de lucha 2D en lugar del Melty Blood? Y yo te dire. ¿Que otro juego de lucha tiene un gato de medio metro parlante que tira ojos laser por los ojos y que puede usar su cuerpo como un cohete a la vez que lucha con una sirvienta mecanica?
Bastante recomendable el juego en si, muy divertido y entretenido. Y que carajos que ronda solo los 20 leuros premoh no seas tacaño.

22738006.review:
TL;DR  The game itself is good but the multiplayer right now doesn't work so well.

My recommendation for this game stems largely from my experiences with it prior to the Steam release.  That said, there is 1 big issue that should be taken into consideration before dropping any money on this port.

First, the Good stuff.
The fighting mechanics feel very nice, but because every fighter is largely quarter-circle, z-motion, and down-down specials, they may feel really close to each other in terms of controls.  I personally came to like this, as it made every fighter feel accessible, while at the same time still forcing you to actually learn how they play, but some others may not feel this way, so keep that in mind.  Also, the soundtrack is pretty rad too.  There is also an abundance of character playstyles, as there are 31 total characters, but each character has 3 different Moon-Styles, which are somewhat similar to Mortal Kombat X's variant types.  And these 3 different styles, while having similar moves, all perform considerably different from each other, so it doesn't feel entirely like you're playing the exact same character.  As far as Singleplayer content goes, this game packs about as much stuff as you would expect from any fighting game: there's the standard Arcade Mode, a Versus Mode, and a Training Mode.  Arcade Mode is where you'll get the 'story' for the game, if you're into that stuff, and from what I've seen the story is pretty enjoyable, especially for Type-Moon fans who are already familiar with the series.  If you play solo, or locally with a friend, then this game will serve you just fine.

Unfortunately, I can't say the same for the online multiplayer.
As of right now, the netplay for this port is just awful.  I spent a good 15 minutes just trying to connect to somebody online, and the one time I managed to actually start a match, I was experiencing a good whole second or two of input lag, which basically made the match unplayable.  From what I hear, I'm not the only one this happened to either.  Hopefully ArcSys fixes this, as it seems like they're well aware of the issue, which is the primary reason I still recommend this game.

Overall, I give this game a solid 7/10.  As good as this game is, the poor netplay seriously holds this game back.  That said, if you're willing to wait a bit for the netplay to get fixed, or if you'll mostly be playing offline, then this is a title I definitely recommend.

22683458.review:
手动五行好评！！大学的时候很痴迷，想起来都是满满的青春啊~~~

最开始是隔壁间的室友找同人游戏玩的时候发现了这个游戏（当时还是MBR2501b）。某天我无意撞见他在玩，发现是月姬的角色，就开始迷上了。之所以知道月姬，是因为上大学之前正好看了那个被广为诟病的《真月谭月姬》。。。

那个时候整个宿舍楼含我在内也就三个人玩，但也有滋有味。作为先行者的那个哥们，通过长期手选W叔有着不错的胜率，加上被拉进WOW，就逐渐淡出了。就剩我和另外一哥们，他跟我在同一间屋，也很迷动画，所以我们基本坚持到了毕业。每晚熄灯前，我们都会连战10局，有时候胜利局数接近还会加赛。正好我那间屋有个哥们在买零食，熄灯前有很多同学都会来买，所以经常有人驻足观战，不过貌似都没人入坑就是了。。。
那哥们一般选ciel、nanaya，我则是推到贵、公主、秋叶。对局都打的很欢乐，用现在的话来说，叫菜鸡互啄、激情四射。。。


再往后，随着时间流逝，热情也逐渐消退。直到MBAC版本推出，确定为斗剧比赛项目，最后推出PC版本，我的斗志又一次被点燃。我开始在网上找人对战，并逐渐改学五月。一方面，五月虽为配角，但却性格饱满，角色宿命可歌可泣（滑稽）；另一方面，腐乱人形、电波等名人的开发，也让游戏中的她成为一线强角。当然还有一个原因就是：双马尾赛高！！！

在约战过程中，认识了很多朋友，进入了现在的川群，还参加了几次面基。也许是手残、也许是努力不够、也许好胜心不强，反正我的水平一直属于圈子底层。我也就这么安于现状，享受着MB给我带来的乐趣。

后来，工作和生活的繁琐让我渐渐远离了MB。直到MBAACC的推出，我才小回归了一阵。两仪式、武装ciel的推出让我欣喜不已。但已没有了以前的忘我和精力，很快也就淡漠了。

这次steam版的发售，我再次兴奋了一阵。赶紧把过年大促时的一帮子冲动消费全部退款，凑足了钱，等待着MBAACC发售日来临。

    购买的过程是短暂的，游戏界面是熟悉的，还是那个游戏，还是那个手感，但心境已不同以往。没有新角色、新场景，也没有期待的高清重置，甚至网战还遇到问题。不过，也许就这样了。斗剧不存，FTG没落，只希望官方能尽快修复BUG，到时叫上基友，再来重温往日的热血澎湃！

22681890.review:
I have enjoyed this game through all of its iterations and finally getting a Steam release is good. That said, the netcode is not. Arc System Works is currently working to improve it, which is a welcome thing. However, if you are like me and have little to no interest in online and prefer to play with friends locally, this can be a great addition to your library. The game engine is fun, the characters are all varied and there are many of them. Even better, each character comes with three gameplay variations, so in a way, you get thrice the amount of characters advertised. The music is enjoyable and the story mode is quite funny with its comedic skits and pop culture references. A negative thing might be the lack of modes and the aforementioned (currently) bad netcode. 

All in all, highly recommended.

Also, rest in peace, Miyu Matsuki, voice of Hisui and Mech-Hisui. This was one of my favorite roles of hers.

インド！（挨拶）
シエル先輩はかわいい。
どうやらその事実を改めてSteamer（Steamでゲームを遊ぶ人をこう呼ぶ）の皆さんにお伝えしなければならないようだ。
今では少しだけ入手困難なTYPE-MOONの同人ゲーム「月姫」のヒロインといえばシエル先輩である。
カレーがちょっと大好き過ぎるけど、真面目で頼れる先輩。
可憐だけれど意外とパワーファイターな扱いを受けていた先輩。
眼鏡が似合う先輩。
眼鏡のON/OFFを選べる先輩。
もちろん外すわけがない先輩。
お尻すら許してくれる先輩。
人気投票で７位を狙ってばかりだった先輩。
部下をさんざんいびるクソ上司なようでちゃんと思いやるところも見せる優しい先輩。
リメイクでチャリ毛を奪われる予定の先輩。
原作ゲームの涙を清らかに流す先輩を見て恋に落ちない奴は人の心を失っているといっても過言ではない。
それぐらいにシエル先輩の涙（と琥珀さんの笑顔）は原作でも屈指の名シーンなのである。
ファンディスクやカーニバルファンタズムでカレーキチガイにされてしまったシエル先輩であるが、そんな先輩がりりしくも可愛らしい声を与えられ縦横無尽にかけまわるのがこのゲームだ。
それだけで買いにきまっている。
13年前にBS-iで見た悪夢のせいで、やれパスタだのやれスパゲティだのと言われてしまった記憶はどこへやら。
同人版のOPで流れていた厨臭い歌もどうやらなくなってしまったが、おかげで先輩の魅力に気づく幸運なSteamer（Steamでゲームを遊ぶ人をこう呼ぶ。しつこいようだけど、これはとても大事なことなんだ）も増えることだろう。
シエル先輩はかわいい。
おしむらくは法衣服だけではなく制服に着替えられないかということで、これはもうぼくはずっとエコールソフトウェアとフランスパンのある方向に念じているけれど、いまだ受理される気配はない。
先輩の制服姿を見てしまうと、みんなが先輩を使ってしまうので、キャラ使用のバランスがおかしくなってしまうことを危惧しているのかもしれない。
しかたないかもしれない。
とりあえずこのゲームが出たというだけでもわたしは大変すばらしいことだと思う。

22639039.review:
It's hard not to recommend this game to anyone that is a fighting game fan or a Type Moon fan. As a fan of both, I was ecstatic to learn that Melty Blood was coming to Steam. For quite some time it's only been available in a copy of Carnival Phantasm(which is ridiculously pricey for what 13 episodes?) and Arc System Works has graciously ported it to Steam.

Pros: 
+ Addicting gameplay 
+ Multiple movesets for each character 
+ Beginner friendly 
+ Fantastic soundtrack 
+ Not a fan translation 
+ Unique and great characters 

Cons: 
- Buggy online play 
- Lag and disconnect are frequent online 
- Side panels that can't be turned off 
- Intro dialogue not translated 

Overall, Melty Blood: Actress Again is worth your money if you enjoy fighting or Type Moon games. It's fun and addicting as hell that is easy to pick up and contains very satisfying gameplay. The few cons are the online play but are currently being fixed. Definitely pick it up. 

4.5/5

22624441.review:
[h1]Sobre o jogo[/h1]

Originado de Tsukihime, obra irmã de Fate, da Type-Moon, Melty nasceu indie, vindo a tornar-se entre 2004 e 2010 um dos mais populares jogos de luta no Japão em virtude de sua simplicidade e profundidade, além de outros fatores, como fluidez, liberdade de movimentação e infindáveis formas de fazer sequências, seja combo ou batendo na defesa.

Inicialmente criado para se fazer os combos mais incríveis que se podia conceber, e tornado conhecido por isso, em 2005, com seu lançamento para fliperamas, o jogo toma outra perspectiva - tornar-se equilibrado e competitivo. Em 2007, jogando com personagem tido à unanimidade por mais fraco, um jogador chamado Denpa, enfrenta ferrenha competição de jogadores renomados de uma comunidade já grande e apta e sagra-se campeão da SBO, na época maior campeonato de luta do mundo, com o personagem. Estava provado - o jogo estava mais do que equilibrado. De lá para cá somam-se 7 versões novas do jogo, de evolução e melhorias, todas bem recebidas.

Hoje o jogo é um clássico, embora ainda poucos fora do Japão o conheçam. Mas mesmo fora do Japão e sem nunca ter sido lançado internacionalmente antes de 19.4.2016, o jogo tem jogadores e comunidades dedicadas, chegando a ponto de ter sido eleito por voto popular para a lineup do maior evento de jogos de luta do mundo em 2010, a EVO. Imagine tamanho feito para um jogo que sequer havia sido lançado. Algo há nele, e os jogadores sabem o que é - a jogabilidade. Ao contrário do que muitos pensam, mais por ser um jogo desconhecido por aqui, anime e com resolução baixa, Melty é um jogo com uma jogabilidade extremamente bem acabada, agradável, fluída, variada e complexa e, quase sempre, quem se dá o direito a testar, não se arrepende.

No Brasil, em outros países e também nos Estados Unidos, porém, o cenário é parecido, uma cena pequena e dedicada, o que afasta jogadores atrás de maiores perspectivas. Porém tanto lá quanto aqui, vários desses mesmos jogadores gostam do jogo e gostariam de poder jogá-lo com uma perspectiva maior. Talvez se as pessoas fizessem o que realmente gostariam de fazer o jogo tivesse essa perspectiva. E agora, que o jogo está na steam e tem ranked match, é possível que isso aconteça.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

[b]Jogo neutro baseado na iniciativa.[/b] 
O meta se define basicamente em se movimentar e prever, adiantando-se ao oponente. Isso porque são raras opções que são sempre certas. Em Street Fighter, por exemplo, se alguém pula em você, a resposta certa é anti-aéreo, já em Melty isso é invertido, isto é, os ataques aéreos têm prioridade aos feitos no chão. O jogo inverte os fatores porque quer que os jogadores vão pra cima, não que fiquem na defensiva. Em outras palavras se o oponente chega com um golpe aéreo é porque você, para a ideia do jogo, perdeu na movimentação. Isso significa dizer que é sempre errado deixar o oponente chegar? Também não, apenas é desvantajoso de modo geral, mas você pode tirar vantagem da situação se prever o que o oponente fará e tiver uma resposta que funcione. O fator previsão, porém, é bem mais amplo que isso, referindo-se principalmente em prever a própria movimentação do oponente, bem como saber identificar e se beneficiar das aberturas ou mesmo interceptá-lo. Da mesma forma, envolve saber se movimentar de forma que consiga fazê-lo errar, seja mostrando uma falsa abertura ou o pressionando, deixando-o desconfortável e sem espaço.

[b]Proteção contra cross-up.[/b] 
Desde que você tenha começado a defender antes de o personagem do oponente te cruzar pelo ar, você pode defender o ataque aéreo apertando para qualquer dos lados. Algo almejado por muitos jogadores de jogos de luta, está presente na série há mais de década. 

[b]Agarrões são mais lentos. Mix-ups.[/b] 
Para compensar, pois com proteção contra cross-ups se teria um jogo em que seria difícil enganar a defesa de alguém, os agarrões em Melty são mais demorados. O que isso tem a ver, alguém perguntaria. Simples, é normalmente possível bater antes de tomar um agarrão, o que significa que você pode explorar bater por cima ou cair no chão e bater por baixo sem tanto medo de tomar um agarrão assim que tocar o chão, como ocorre em outros jogos. Isso aumenta o potencial de mix-up de forma absurda, e inclusive por isso Melty também é conhecido por ter a maior variedade e os mix-ups mais incríveis dos jogos de luta. Isso, de o agarrão demorar um pouco mais, inclusive serve para se evitar a situação que se tem hoje em vários jogos, em que variar entre golpe e agarrão é basicamente um mix-up 50/50. Em Melty, se você achar que será agarrado e bater, seu golpe irá bater antes de você ser agarrado. Ainda, outra coisa que evita os famosos tick throws, que é essa situação de bater ou agarrar, é o fato de os golpes em Melty causarem, mesmo os mais fracos, algum hitstun considerável, impossibilitando que se agarre logo em seguida. 

[b]Combos básicos fáceis e adaptáveis, e também combos difíceis.[/b] 
Melty Blood se tornou conhecido por ser um jogo para se fazer combos incríveis, e isso está presente nele até hoje. O sistema de combo é bastante livre e fluído, possibilitando que se possa usar de criatividade. A facilidade se dá, em parte, em razão da mecânica de jump cancel, que possibilita pular a partir de quase qualquer golpe. Por isso, combar no jogo não é para ser difícil, pelo contrário, é muito acessível, o que faz com que combos ocupem um papel secundário na hora da partida. Ainda assim, alguns personagens têm combos difíceis, às vezes não por serem a versão com mais dano ou a mais legal, mas por oferecem uma vantagem - levar para o canto, derrubar de um jeito que permita uma situação de mix-up, etc; são opções para quem quer melhorar seu jogo, e isso é uma característica em Melty, ser fácil de pegar, mas difícil de masterizar.

[b]Liberdade para atacar como quiser.[/b] 
Grande parte dessa liberdade de sequências, seja combo ou batendo na defesa, também se dá em conta de uma mecânica chamada reverse beat, que somente a lua F não tem, que é a opção de cancelar um golpe mais forte em um mais fraco. O reverse beat vem para simplificar e complicar tudo, pois permite todas as variações entre golpes, mais fortes e mais fracos, baixos e altos, independentemente da ordem, desde que um mesmo golpe não se repita. Isso possibilita uma imensidade de variação em diversas camadas do gameplay, dando nova inteligência e complexidade ao jogo. Essa mecânica, somada à de jump cancel, ao mesmo tempo que simplifica a vida do iniciante, permite a existência de uma nova gama de opções a serem exploradas por jogadores experts, agradando tanto os mais casuais quanto os mais hardcores.

[b]Movimentação extrema.[/b] 
Também uma das maiores características do Melty é a imensa liberdade de movimentação. Cada personagem tem um airdash diferente, que muitas vezes só de trocar de lua já muda, ocorrendo da mesma forma com o airbackdash (o airdash para trás). Além disso, tem-se dois pulos que se pode usar independente de já ter usado airdash ou não, diferente dos outros jogos da ASW. Ainda, cada um dos pulos pode ser feito como superpulo se, antes de pular, apertar pra baixo. Também é possível usar o segundo pulo para fazer um IAD que comece já no ar e, por fim, as luas Crescent e Half tem a opção de usar esquiva no ar, o que retarda a queda e vira o personagem para o lado do oponente. No chão se tem dash pra frente, backstep, todos também com propriedades próprias para cada personagem, e tem o IAD que, em razão do airdash ser diferente para cada personagem, também irá variar de acordo.

22622129.review:
The game has aged graphically, but is still one of the most entertaining Fighting games available, even for a casual demographic. Although having a roster with half of them being clones, is a very solid game with an easy learning curve. Every character and style is viable despite maybe a few rough matchups (Excluding the Necos if you treat them as joke characters), so once you pick a favorite you're ready to go.

If you're one of the few who gets a huge interest on this genre's story mode (in this case Arcade), you're in a tough situation. Not only you have to play vanilla Melty Blood (Which had routes and Apocalypse-joke bosses), but also have knowledge of the Tsukihime series. You might get some hints from the Fate/ series or Kara no Kyokai (Also by Type-Moon and in the same universe), but only huge fans of the series and/or the company will know most of the lore and inner jokes the dialogue will keep throwing at you.

The port is very solid thanks to being a quite old game so even the most ancient PC is able to run it without problems, but still has some small problems. Once in a while the game might crash, and in my experience happens during Arcade. For some reason the game also takes a lot of the CPU to run, but until is solved in a patch you can solve it on Task Manager.

Don't be fooled by the decade old sprites. Melty Blood is a very solid fighting game with a cult following still going wild nowadays.

22602930.review:
2 Years ago, I was searching the wiki when I found a game made by french bread, which I knew to be the developers for under night in birth. Upon researching further, I found many people saying that it was one of the smoothest, funnest, hardest, and rewarding fighters they had ever played. Wanting context, I went and played Tsukihime, the visual novel ( from 2000 ( Its pretty ancient )), and left with not only a newly found addiction to VN's, but a love for my new favorite company aside from nintendo (type moon) and one of the most enjoyable fighting games I have ever played. If you find fighting games more fun to play than to watch, then Melty Blood is what you've been looking for. If you love beautiful, fluent sprite work, then Melty is godsend. If you want a fictional world filled with alot of consepts and philosophy, then Tsukihime is for you, and you'll find soul in your character. I think this is arc systems hidden gem revealed to the world, and I cannot exaggerate how great a game this is.

Pros:
+ Its incredibly fast paced
+ The mindgame potential in some matchups are incredibly high
+ A huge focus to movement options
+ High pressure situations
+ Well balanced gameplay
+ Great shoutout to fans of Tsukihime / Kagetsu Toya

Cons:
- Fairly hard to learn
- Netplay has always had problems
- Many players have played for decades, so its pretty hard to get into, and the meta has pretty much already been set by the Japanese community 8 years ago...
- Based off of a now obscure eroge

____才安装STEAM不久,也才玩了一会儿,说说见闻.感觉和老版MBAACC相比暂时变动不大的样子.注:暂时没打补丁.系统WIN7X64.
____本次是因为意外有个玩家送了我一份授权我才会装STEAM平台以及测试这个版本,不然老版玩着没啥问题我不需要这个新版本.先感谢他.
1 执行EXE之前先开编辑器搜了一下EXE,键位还是妈逼/他妈社(MB/TM)系列的一贯老标准,感谢官方没有改动这些标准,我能轻易改好键位,不需要再进游戏去改.很多游戏键位根本没告诉在哪里改,以及使用的格式或者标准,我希望以后的作者能尽量声明此事项,输入问题解决不了的话我这种毛病多的可能就直接删掉了,因为不能打嘛~
2 0809的自带霸体看起来没修,这样让修改党无法互相伤害233,建议去掉自带的霸体.这是我最主要的需求.当然这种规则上的修改会导致选了UNLIMITED的老版RPD不能在STEAM版回放,不过这不是问题.
3 ANSI没改成UNICODE,因此我想看日文就得APP加载执行,不然大陆区还是乱码.
4 CPU占用率较老版明显要高,我的硬件老,CPU基本80%,BED倒是没卡死什么的.在STEAM里面执行的时候STEAM给我装了一次DIRECTX.
5 老版RPD可以直接使用,猜测是因为很多东西都没有动过的缘故.也许一部分文件也是通用的.
6 联机方面因为没看到ARC MODE的排行所以没有测试,据说联机效果渣,不过对于我这种只打AI的,PVP优化对我影响不大.
7 和老版相比多了一些成就,也是跟我没关系.
8 单机模式的成就貌似开挂也可以,比如1E的8KDAMAGE,我开挂选个09随便虎摸一下就有了.占了大部分的UNLIMITED可能因为代码和常规版不一样了导致不被统计.
9 我在OPTIONS里面的设定和老版一样,DAMAGE LV3,三局两胜.印象中STAGE7有一次是赢完了两局0933才乱入,不知道我记没记错.S FIN+PER我还没监测,感谢明码哈哈哈~

____接下来就看官方怎么修理了...0809不改的话我是没欲望玩这个不能60FPS的版本的.不过一眨眼儿从拿到MBR 2.501B的刻盘到现在也是有十年多了,感谢公司的倾情奉献.既然拿来卖钱不如一并修了吧~~~UNLIMITED做得比较好的可能有BB系列,KOF有的BOSS做得挺舒服的那种也算但是感觉仍然不深,考虑到FTG这种高科技的制作成本也没法多要求什么.[MD]怒之铁拳3那种属于少数招式强化的比较简单的加强版角色.GBA0026的力凯和[PS]SFA3(这个只是见过一次录像)感觉也不错.PK两方存在大水平差距的时候可以使用多种途径来调节,原则上立回第一位立回不作变动所以UNLIMITED的自带霸体就是不应该有的,断线模式适合的有KOF老板子版本的攻防参数,MBAC-B的VS MODE攻击力强度,MAGIC积累速度和消耗量参数,TEKKEN和LB的HP调节,MBR/[PS]SFA3里面UNLIMITED专用的MAGIC能量槽,多个作品里面设计比较完善的UNLIMITED CHARACTER,有选择地屏蔽一部分技能等等.高科技嘛,终究有的地方要做得细致一些的,再简单的规则也掩饰不了这类游戏的深度,自由,和相对的公平.不说什么创新,能把眼下的这些事情做好也会是相当优秀的作品.

____这些年新出的长连段2DFTG看起来都不错的样子,祝这些公司财源广进人才济济.这才是一批正儿八经做东西的大佬.质量好,有本事!

22582748.review:
I really love this game. It's an amazing fighter mechanically, and I've been a huge fan of the Type-Moon setting for years.

But as of right now, about three days after release, this version of the game is bad. Not "PSP port of Fate/Unlimited Codes" bad, where it was a stripped down port, so if you just want to play against other people in the same room it's perfectly fine. Identical to the last PC version that was released.

But the netcode is awful. When the connection's particularly bad, it can make hit-confirms or any sort of reaction-based play completely impossible. Which unfortunately pretty much means Ranked is a crapshoot.

And on top of that, the translation of the Arcade mode is pretty bad. It's littered with typos, names and terms are translated rather inconsistently (Wallachia/Warachia, for example, as well as the regular use of honorifics) and a lot of subtleties aren't conveyed at all for people unfamiliar with the original visual novel (no distinction between Shiki and SHIKI, and characters like Akiha, Hisui, and Miyako all refer to Shiki simply by name most of the time). If you're already a fan of Tsukihime, you'll probably be able to notice when this happens and will probably be able to infer the original intent, but players less familiar with but still interested in the story will be left in the dark.

Though I will say it's nice that most of the setting terms were translated in accordance with the terminology most of the English-speaking fanbase uses. In constrast to, say, Fate/Extra, which can be very jarring for existing fans to read when they start using terms like "Legendary Soul" instead of "Heroic Spirit."

In short, this game is in dire need of some patches to fix the netplay and the scripts. But the underlying game mechanics are as superb as ever.

To be honest, I really want to like this game. I was so hyped because of Type-Moon's Tsukihime and Kara no Kyōkai. However, the netcode really needs some work to it, so until that gets fixed, this review would be a "not recommended".
