Cons:
-Netcode's extreme lag. I experienced about 3 seconds of input delay in my most recent few games. In the beginning, the netcode was working fine with no lag, so I had no issues then, but after my 2nd game, the multiplayer just constantly lagged halfway through the first round. The input delay kept getting worse and worse from there, hitting about 3 seconds of delay at the end.


Overall, I'm waiting to see if the netcode lag will be fixed in a few weeks, because if this remains like this, I'll have to return it because the multiplayer is often unplayably bad.

I was utterly stunned when I saw this on Steam. This game has been around for a long while, but was almost impossible to get a proper copy of: it only came with the boxed-set version of a parody anime called Carnival Phantasm.

Now it's here, well.. put it this way: it's the best "doujin" style fighter by a country mile. It was made INTO an arcade machine. Now, yes, it is 2D, it uses drawn graphics so it's not completely smooth and they are a bit pixelated because it was made for an unusual resolution, but still, the gameplay is fantastic.

Highly recommended for anyone who likes fighting games, even if some of the characters are a bit weird (and unless you're familiar with the backstory of several obscure visual novels you won't recognize them). Oh, and go watch some Carnival Phantasm subs on YouTube too, it's hilarious, especially after you've played this game..

22564377.review:
One of the finest fighting games to this date.

Featuring the richest character variation, incredible animations, an outstanding soundtrack and refined mechanics, Melty Blood has been the masterpiece of developer French Bread, also recently known for Under Night In-Birth and Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax. 

With the Steam release, Arc System Works brings the game in its final and most recent version to PC and even adds a full English localization, ingame controller configuration, Steam matchmaking, rankings and a long awaited lobby system for the (currently wonky) netplay.

Melty Blood has gifted me with [i]thousands[/i] of hours played over the years from its first version in 2002. Thousands of hours of fun playing, enjoying watching great players, listening to the soundtrack, spending in training mode to discover new things about the character I play, getting mad at strong characters and players, improving my own skill and never getting tired of it. Ever.

I'm happy to see the day this game gets its proper treatment after years of being available only via illegal methods due to the limited stock of the BluRay it came with. It's about time.

See you in Melty.

22558126.review:
I killed many many hours in the arcade with friends years back playing the original version of this game.  When that place shut down I was devastated.  Thanks to whoever brought this awesome game to Steam.  Now for a (admittedly biased) review...

This has long been my favorite fighting game of all time though not exactly because it is the best fighting game in the world.  I do not have the reflexes or the technical skills to dominate at Street Fighter or King of Fighters because those games require very sharp very specific abilities.  Melty Blood has never seemed that way to me.  I won't go so far as to say "a fighting game for button mashers" but at times imbalances in the game allow you to get away with that.  To be fair my experiences were with the original.  Further I will say that I have been absolutely demolished enough time by a skilled Chaos player or a Shiki player who simply didn't let me touch them to know that, if you have those skills and reflexes I lack, there is enough technical possibilities here to delight any fighting game fan.

Summary:  A fighting game for the masses (in my opinion) that still has enough technical ability to let players who want to play competitively do so while still letting those of us who just love to kick our friends butts with anime characters (and have our butts kicked by them) have fun.

I can't recommend this game enough.  BUY IT!  You won't regret it.

Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code (ขอย่อว่าMBAA)
เป็นเกมแนวไฟท์ติ้ง ที่มีต้นเรื่องมาจากเกมแนวVisual Novel ซึ่งก็คือเกม Tsukihime นั่นเอง
ซึ่งอยู่ในซีรี่ย์ของค่าย Type-Moon และอยู่ในจักรวาลเดียวกับFateซีรี่ย์ทั้งหลาย
เกมนี้เป็นภาคสุดท้ายของเกมMelty Blood
วางขายครั้งแรกเมื่อปี2011 เข้าสตีมและได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษปี2016

ประวัติตัวเกมที่เหลือก็เชิญหากันเอง มาดูด้านตัวเกมบ้าง

-ด้านกราฟฟิคก็สวยตามยุคสมัย(เป็นคำรีวิวที่ขอไปทีมาก lol)
-เพลงประกอบเพราะ

22546163.review:
虽然月姬格斗是一款粉丝向的格斗游戏，如今在steam平台上发售也是TypeMoon[strike]一贯的[/strike]炒冷饭行为，但是它绝对可以称得上是一款优秀的格斗游戏。
月姬与很多格斗游戏在系统上有着比较大的差异，同时对于型月世界的角色刻画亦是本作的重点之一。月姬格斗自02年发售之后，一直有着非常稳定的粉丝群体，我和我身边的不少朋友也一直都很喜欢这款游戏，虽然可能比较小众化，但是在如此长的时间内能够吸引着这些玩家，也从侧面说明了月姬格斗本身较好的游戏品质。
至于月姬格斗的操作和难度方面，可以用“易于上手，难于精通”八个字来概括，基本按键只有ABC三个，大部分的指令也非常简单，必杀也可以很轻易的搓出来。打打CPU过过剧情什么的非常轻松。另外本作的输入判定非常的宽松，所以新手也可以很快的适应输入判定。
但是你如果想要练习华丽的连招或者跟玩家来一场真正的较量就需要一定的练习了，首先月姬连招需要确认难度都是目押级别的，再加上格斗系统有一定的复杂度，光是熟悉人物和三种不同的月型就需要花上不少时间，另外现在还在坚持玩这个游戏的都是深海大触了，而且要约战，所以你如果是个刚入坑的小粉丝想要通过这个游戏来寻找与人斗的快感可能需要苦练一番。
月姬相比其他的格斗游戏非常强调进攻，气槽在被动防御或者受伤后增长非常微量，但是击中对方会增加很多，气槽满了也会慢慢自动降低。加上可以快速接近对方的空中冲刺系统，被攻击之后受身也相当快，而且受身之后可以直接冲刺进行反击，使得对局的节奏非常紧凑。至于防御方面，本作设置了特殊的精防按键，在攻击打到之前按出可以完全防御住这次进攻，还能争取到有利帧数，满气暴气防住还会出隐藏，非常的酷炫。必杀和超必杀的动画效果也是无比炸裂，一定不会让你失望。
当然刚刚在steam平台上发售的它也有着不少的缺点，比如网战服务器简直渣渣，卡的不要不要的，希望官方可以解决一下这个问题。
顺便一提同厂的《夜晚降生》似乎也将在2016年夏季登陆STEAM，值得期待~

22544608.review:
I highly recommend this game if you're one of the following.
1. 2D Fighting game fan
2. Typemoon Fan
3. General Anime fan

I've played tons of fighting games but I'm in no way super competitive so I can't explain to you what this game has as far as mechanics over other titles. what I can tell you is that it's characters is highly diverse with even the silliest ones fitting well into the world. There is no story mode however the Arcade mode of the game will provide at least enough dialogue to get you invested in the fighter, their goals (or lack thereof), and a hint of the lore. 
To add to that each character has three different styles. Crescent, Half, and Full moons. If you're a combo heavy player you'll enjoy Crescent Moon style. Full moon style gives you hard hits and decent damage at the sacrifice of usually being slight slower. Finally Half-Moon style cuts out a lot of the more complicate mechanics and usually gives your character a more vast move set that is a mix of the other two. This essentially gives the already sizable cast nearly triple the size as they can play like a totally different fighter depending on the style you pick

The music of the game is fairly well done with a mix of mellow and harder hitting tracks. Plenty of stages, and while this game is a bit old the sprite work is still hasn't aged a day. 

The netplay has been solid for me so far. Haven't had trouble playing in over 4 man lobbies.  Honestly there isn't very many flaws I can personally come up with. It is, and has remained, one of my favorite 2d fighting games and I once again highly recommend it.

私よりスペックが低い人でも快適に対戦が出来ていますし、逆に私よりスペックが高い人でも重くてまともに遊べない人もいます。

ゲーム自体が強制終了される事はありませんが、まだ熱帯はまともに遊べない方は多いようです。
ランクマ、プレマどちらも遊んでみましたが、最初は普通に対戦出来ても、後半になるにつれて入力の2秒後に攻撃が出るなどラグが酷い時もあります。
また、普通に試合が出来ててもいきなり回線が切れることもあります（自分や相手が故意に切断したのではないです）
ニコ生などを見ると安定して対戦出来ている人もいるので、回線やスペックの問題も多かれ少なかれあるかと思いますが、しかし「100％まともに対戦出来てる～」という人は周りにはいません。
「カニファン版は普通に遊べた！」という人でもスチーム版は全然遊べない…という自分みたいな人も結構多いようなので、購入の際にはご注意を。

ただ熱帯を覗けば本当に面白いゲームなので、トレモやストーリを楽しみたい目的なら有りだと思います。

There is no reason to purchase Melty Blood in its current state. As it stands the Network mode is inferior to cccaster, making matchmaking games considerably more slower and frustrating presumably due to a lack of rollbck, as well as defeating the purpose of having a Melty Blood Steam release.

I can't speak for the quality of the translations but I've heard few complaints from others. 

It should also be said that there seems to be a great deal of issues surrounding keybindings and such where certain keys(such as the start menu/TAB key) cannot be reassigned. While this may seem miniscule it should be noted that these are also able to be assigned through the cccaster version. 

The Steam Version offers no new additional content, and even fails to include the Boss Rush mode(As well as Riesfbye Route B) of the previous PS2 version. 

In short you're better off using the cccaster version which, while having an incomplete translation, certainly tops having to pay Gabe all your Steam Bux.

It isn't worth even a quarter of the price it's currently at, I suggest picking up the cccaster version instead and using other methods to interact with the Melty community.

22541762.review:
Yes, finally! 
I've been waiting for this game to be released in the US officially on Steam! 

Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code v1.07 with all the latest patches had been put together well and without the need of a workaround and fan-made english translation patch to make the game work. However, if you've used the Mirror Moon fan translation patch that was still being worked on, you can tell the dialogue differs much from this release. Also, remember to use CCaster if you want good online gameplay and better matches.

The gameplay is awesome, smooth, and fast-paced with combos that can be easy to make and air dash combos are very fun to pull off! There a total of 31 characters if you count the three moon styles for each character. So, you're going to have a great time to discover and play with most of the characters to familarize and creating yout mains. The animation for each of the characters are great and fun to look at.

This game series is a underrated gem and when I share the game to people; they either never heard of the game before or any of the Type-Moon universe at all! Even, when they're average gamers, too bad they messed out on this hidden gem!

Melty Blood is an niece fighting game that is pretty well known to the fighting game community thanks to being released back in December 2002 on Japan followed by the Re-Act expansion and the later the arcade sequel Act Cadenza both released 2004 and 2005 respectively. Then the Act Cadenza Ver. B was released in 2007 with balance issues fixes and bug fixes plus unique added features such as tag team. The first Melty Blood is the sequel to the famous Tsukihime visual novel from Type-Moon, the story takes place about 1 year after the events from the visual novel from the true Arucied ending of Tsukihime.

Type Moon and French Bread did a wonderful job of updating and fixing the game with many updates and the later updates is Actress Again and the first revision came out in 2008 and the final update which is v1.07 with the 1.4.0 patch is Actress Again Current Code which was released only Carnival Phantasm Season 3 Blu-ray limited edition! The set became extremely rare and hard to find in Japan, so many Type-Moons such as us won't be to buy and play the game officially instead we'd have to pirate the game with the fan translation patch.

Due to how awesome this fighting game is compare to other ones is how there are 3 fighting styles to each characters plus the nature of accessible to newcomers and veterans alike! The combo and air combo chains make Melty Blood an awesome game! The elegant memorable iconic characters, story, setting, vampires, and the wonderful music will make you keep coming back to play again and again! Melty Blood is still being talked about today after the final revision update came out back in December 31, 2011 on Windows PC. 

My most favortie characters is the following: Vampire Sion/Sion TATARI, Arcueid Brunestud, Kouma Kishima, Ryougi Shiki, and Riesbyfe Stridberg. They're one of my mains, so I enjoy using them a lot I love Sion and Vampire Sion the most, I love her personality and character! She is not a vampire fan and pretty angsty about her condition if you know about her backstory. It is why I love her and enjoy her stotic determined intelligent nature and at the same time controlling her vampiric impulses.

Melty Blood Actress Again takes place after a year from the true ending of Melty Blood folliowing the events of the expansion pack Melty Blood Re-ACT and  Melty Blood Act Cadenza. A event known as 'Hologram Summer' appears repeating the events from the first Melty Blood.

I am grateful to the Mirror Moon staff of working hard on the english translation patch and the able to understand and play the Melty Blood series on PC which was a Japanese only release. 

I love Melty Blood and I am a huge fan of the game series, I collect almost all of the scale figures and the prize figures plus the physical copy of the games and the Carnival Phantasm Blu-ray Complete limited edition set! I am also a huge Type-Moon fanatic so I am obessed with the Nasuverse and the Fate series too! But I enjoy and love Tsukihime more and I can't wait for the Tsukihime remake visual novel to come out in Japan sooner and later with a english translation patch later on! 

This is the first Melty Blood game ever officially released on Steam.

Whether you're new or old to this series, I recommend to buy this game now and hopefully it will convince Arc Drive Systems and French Bread to release the earlier Melty Blood games on Steam! 

I still suck at this game and not too good when playing aganist opponents, because I get destroyed easily. I should have discovered Melty Blood and the Nasuverse a long time ago but I was a fool then...Melty Blood is what started for me to discover Tsukihime and the Fate series!

So buy and enjoy playing this awesome cult-classic fighting game which is not too well known to the mainstream masses due to being a Japan-only release at that time and it's a Vampire fighting game which is pretty rare!

Empecemos:
Este juego salio por allá de 2009 con el MBAA para Arcade y PS2, luego actualizando a este que es el MBAA Current Code. 2 personajes nuevos y más balance.

ONLINE; una de las razones del porqué comprarlo .. se trabaja en ello la inclusión del rollback está próxima, hasta el momento yo, que soy de México no he tenido problemas respecto al ONLINE, basado en Delay es uno de los onlines sólidos que me han tocado ver, lo categorizo a nivel de las series de Arcana y Blazblue Continuum y no Chronophantasma; ese sí es un buen online.

En cuanto a la jugabilidad de lo mejor, realmente. El tener 31 personajes elegibles de por si, dice mucho ya, esto se pone mejor ... tenemos a disponibilidad 93 personajes esto debido al sistema de las "Lunas"; C-Moon, H-Moon y F-Moon [le dan a cada personaje nuevo move-set] y, en ocasiones el modo Eclipse [solo disponible en algunos momentos del modo historia].
Todo esto en conjunto lo hace un juego muy, muy accesible, divertido, ofensivo y técnico a la vez.

Y ESTO ES SÓLO UN QUEMÓN DE LO QUE ES ESTA MARAVILLA.

Contras:
*Network Mode: Básico, no está muy bien complementado como algunos otros, por lo menos puedes entrenar en lo que alguien entra; Rank y Player Match.
*Resolución: En sí este juego tiene una resolución media, no es "HD" como otros casos, sprites pequeños.
*Dificultad: Aún en modo "Hardest" el juego es sencillo de pasar, casos como Ryes y Tohno se ponen dificiles en ocasiones pero, no tanto.

De todas maneras, es una compra OBLIGADA¡¡ Para todo amante de FG´s o, incluso, personas que quieras experimentar un juego balanceado, completo y divertido.

22540374.review:
It's MELTY!

Most people buying this game have been playing it and its predecessors for over a decade, either by importing it through some dodgy online shop, or through other less official means. It's good this game got its long overdue official localization. 

If you're new to this game and wondering if you should buy it, it's a fairly easy game to pick up at any skill level or experience with fighting games in general. It's fairly well balanced and has a bunch of neat mechanics, which keeps it interesting at a higher skill level. Most of the special moves are fairly easy to execute, with the most difficult ones being a half circle on a controller/stick. The gameplay itself is fast paced compared to most others in the genre. There's a wide variety of characters to play with, and each character comes with three styles to experiment with. I'll spare you the details, but it should give you enough variation to keep the game fresh and fun for a long time.

The graphics might look a bit dated, but if you keep in mind that the original artwork for this game is older than a decade it's not really a surprise. That said, given the general style of the game it doesn't really get in the way, and it doesn't matter with the gameplay anyway. The music for most stages is very well done, and sometimes a little too catchy.

As for multiplayer... By default as it is, it's a good game for playing with a friend coming over, but the netcode for online play is abominable. Previous iterations of this game were often played using the help of an external tool called CCCaster, so I'm sure something similar will come out over time to make the experience more enjoyable. A bit of a shame the netcode didn't get an update, but I really wasn't expecting a major update to this particular age old problem.

On the downside, if you do play against someone over the internet, chances are they've been playing this game on and off for roughly 10 years, and have likely at some point tossed a few 100 yen coins into one of the machines still present in some of the arcade halls in Akihabara today. 

Good times... 

JUST BUY IT ALREADY!

22540248.review:
元はTYPE MOONの同人ゲームである月姫の設定を基にした渡辺製作所（フランスパン）の格闘ゲームです。
TYPE MOONと共同開発で出来たMELTY BLOODは格闘ゲームとしてだけではなく月姫のIFとも後日談とも読めるストーリー展開そのものも非常に魅力的でした。
数年後さらにその後日談になるMELTY BLOODRe・ACTやらMELTY BLOOD Act Cadenzaがでて、さらにその後日談に当るのが今作Melty Blood Actress Again Current Codeです。


うん、月姫のころからおっかけてきましたが、新規の方がストーリー的にそろそろ置いてきぼりもいいところの部分が目に見えてきたのでメルブラ全作品を収録した作品を出してくれても良くなってきたと思うのです。

…大丈夫、ストーリーとかバックラウンドとか良くわからなくても格闘ゲームとしては１０年以上更新し続けたおかげで格闘ゲームとしてはものすごく安定した感じになっておりますから。

というわけで、より作品を楽しませるためにTYPE MOONは早急に月姫リメイクを出すべきだとぼかぁ思います。
商業作品として出た空の境界の限定版に月姫リメイクの製作を記載してから１０年以上経っているのにはなかなか驚愕しますけどね。
月姫もってない方からすりゃ、ずーっとやきもきさせっぱなしなんだよなぁ、このめるぶらシリーズとFateの魅力に取り付かれた人たちからすりゃ。


さて、Carnival Phantasm 3rd Seasonに特典としてついてきたMelty Blood Actress Again Current Codeとまったく同じですね。
さすがに細かい判定やら何やらまでは差異がわかりませんが、モードやら使用キャラやらなにやらは表向きの部分はまったくいっしょ。

一応、OVAおまけ特典版にもオンラインモードはあったわけですが、あっという間に売り切れてなくなったOVAの特典ってわけですからプレイヤーの数に限りがあり、なんというか新規のプレイヤーがまったく現れない内輪状態でした。

だが、STEAMに出るとなれば話は違う、プレイヤーがどんどん増えていくという状態よ。というわけでオンラインモードに期待していたのですが、発売初日のバージョンはなんと言うかまだラグいですね。

正直、プレイヤー人数増えることでオンライン対戦が充実するという点くらいしかOVA特典版とは差異がないわけですのでこの点は早急に改善を願う。そうじゃないとOVA特典のプレイヤー側としては何のために買ったのかさっぱりわからない状態に。

てなわけで、期間限定でなんかついてくるわけでもないのでOVA特典版持ちの方はまだ慌てて買わなくても大丈夫ですよ～。もーちょい様子を見てから買うといいです。

コントローラーに関してですが昔からある規格のDirectInput仕様のコントローラーしか認識しません。XBOX360用コントローラーなどのXinput仕様のゲームコントローラーぶっさしっぱなしでいたのでそっちを使用してみたらキーが暴走している状態で認識しているとは言いがたかった。

22538443.review:
After +13 years of waiting, its finally here. Considered one of the holy grails of fighters, Melty Blood: Actress Again Current Code has finally released in the States thanks in a big part to publisher Arc System Works. Melty Blood started originally as a doujin fighting game co-developed by  French-Bread, Ecole Software and Type-Moon, the very same Type-Moon thats behind the Fate/Stay Night visual novel series. Melty Blood is a follow up to Tsukihime which is another VN title made by Type-Moon. Its not necessarly to play Tsukihime first in order to enjoy Melty Blood, but it does help to get a better grasp of the overall lore and characters of the series. Melty Blood has gone through a number of itterations which leads into this latest version released on Steam. What stands out from other fighters is that despite the simple 5 button set up there's quite of bit of layers and complexity with its mechanics. 3 different fighting styles for each of the 31 character roster gives the potential of near limitless possibliies on finding your perfect fighter. This along with an online mode gives the potential for a thriving community.



Pros:

-A total of 31 characters, each with 3 optional fighting styels to choose from giving different results on how they play

-The music for the most part gives that supernatural vibe one would expect from Tsukihime

-The simple 5 button set up is easy to grasp, but the layers and complexity of the game's mechanics with their own risk/rewards and features makes for a much beefy fighter that even some of the more mainstream fighters today have yet to achieve

-The story mode, while straight forward, does in part make you feel as if one was playing a visual novel

-The online mode is simple fairly easy to navigate and does the job of getting a match going



Cons:

-The available modes offered is standard at best

-The online mode, while mostly fuctional, is something to be desired since this version of Melty Blood AACC doesnt use CCCaster, but a delay beased built.

-Being that this is a decade old game, there is some age shown in the visuals, especially some of the screen tearing during fights. It doesnt break the game but it is present even with your gpu's V-sync on.

-The game isn't quite newbie friendly for those looking for a simple fighter to jump into.



Vertict:

Thumbs up and an easy high reccomendation for experienced fighting fans especially for those who want a complete experience in their fighters (looking at you SF5). The online mode needs some tweeking and the screen tearing is at times annoying. Hopefully some of these issues will be addressed with patches. The $25 price point is a little high for a decade old fighter as Melty Blood, but there's nothing wrong waiting for a sale knocking it down to $20 or lower. Either way you're still getting a premium fighting game to add to your library.

22533057.review:
Melty blood is a fighting game series developed by French Bread (ragnarok battle offline, under night in-birth, dengeki bunko fighting climax) in partnership with Typemoon (Tsukihime, Fate/Stay night, Kara no Kyoukai).

There's 2 mechanic concepts that characterize melty blood:

One is the air mobility. Melty blood chars have various types of jumps and airdashes combinations that lead to changing direction in the air multiple times.
The jump angles aren't so variated as kof as you don't have a superjump backwards or hops, but you can control the falling arc of neutral jump/superjump/doublejump and can combine jumps/superjumps/doublejumps with airdashes very freely.

The other is how projectyles work. 
There is no projectyle colisions in the game. The usual for projectyles is to pass throght each other, but if they do destroy each other they have a normal hurtbox that can be destroyed with a normal attack. 
There is a marker for projectyle types of moves, but it is only used to mark what can be reflected.
Btw, Melty have a lot of "projectyle looking things" that don't reach fullscreen and can't be reflected.
This combination make projectyle wars dynamics becomes something very different, and generally end very fast with someone taking a hit/blocking/deciding to maneuver around it or away form it.

As a feature of the "Actress Again" subseries, we have as a stample feature a "groove system" with 3 styles.
Each style have their subset of mechanics (like kof 98 or cvs2), but a different moveset too (like mkx).

Crescent Moon is based on the general mechanic of old versions. 
This means that this groove retains multiple defensive options ("parry", dodge, "alpha counter", "burst", etc) and the moveset is commonly based on the older versions with some new tricks added. 
The crescent groove usually will have the largest moveset (really hard to predict), but not necessarily the strongest individual moves. 
Due to retaining the meter mechanic from older games, they have the best control of it.

Half Moon and Full Moon are original takes on mechanic and moveset, and usually leads to more simple and straight foward characters.

Half Moon can be considered the "speed groove". 
Their walkspeed an dashes are the same or faster than Crescent Moon versions.
For some characters jumps/airdashes startup/landing/travel speed is slightly better too.
They have less control over the meter, but gains acess to a better "alpha counter" with it and a sucessfull "parry" triggers a auto-counter that launch in the air. 
All of them have a sequence of 3 attacks triggered by imputing 5a6aa, that is at the same time a basic combo tool and a pressure tool.

Full Moon can be considered the "power groove". 
Their walkspeed and dashes are the same or slower than Crescent Moon versions.
Sometimes their dashes will be a little faster, but less controllable than other versions.
It's very common for their 2A to be a low, jA to be a overhead and to have better frame advantage and hitbox in normals.
Different from other moons, they can cancel the landing recovery into block even after using a attack in the air.

It's important to notice that Crescent Moon and Half Moon have a more freeform chain route, while Full Moon have a more rigid one.
Outside of command normals, Full moon can only follow the "from weak attack to strong", standing Mid to crouching Mid and use a single grounded strong (or standing or crouching) in a chain.
Crescent Moon and Half Moon can go from crouching to standing regardless of the button, and even go "from strong to attack to weak".
This usually will give a more flexible pressure for Crescent and Half moon grooves, with more chances to prolong and reset blockstrings.
But the better frame advantge and proprieties of Full Moon normals compensate this.

22532839.review:
[h1]ゲーム紹介[/h1]
同人サークル「Type-Moon(現在は有限会社ノーツのゲームブランド)」が出した『月姫』という同人ゲームを元にした格闘ゲームです。

メルティブラッド(以下メルブラ)は今から14年も昔の2002年に同人ゲームとして産声を上げました。
最初はバランスが悪かったり動きがもっさりしていましたが、続編となるRe・ACTではゲーム性の向上やバランスの調整、同人ゲームながらプロの声優の起用をしたことでより有名になりました。
その後、アーケード、コンシューマ、PCとハードを変えながら多くのユーザーに愛されたゲームです。


基本は既存の2D格闘ゲームと同様ですが、他の2D格闘ゲームとは異なるメルブラ特有のシステムについていくつか紹介します。

[b]■３つの戦闘スタイル[/b]
すべてのキャラクターに「ハーフムーン(半月)」・「クレセントムーン(三日月)」・「フルムーン(満月)」の３つの戦闘スタイルが存在し、それぞれ異なる挙動になります。
(「Re・ACT」や「Act Cadenza」をプレイしていた方にはキャラクターにもよりますが、クレセントムーンが使いやすいかと思います)

戦闘スタイルごとにエリアル(コンボ)も異なるので、いろいろ試して自分にあったキャラクターとスタイルを探してみてください。

[b]■戦闘開始前の位置取り[/b]
通常の格闘ゲームでは戦闘が開始されてからキャラクターの操作が可能になりますが、メルブラでは戦闘が開始される前からキャラクターの操作が可能になります。
(とはいえ、攻撃できるわけではなくあくまでジャンプやダッシュなどの移動のみです)

これによりインファイトが得意なキャラクターやレンジ攻撃を得意とするキャラクター達による有利な位置とりが戦闘開始前から行われます。

[b]■ゲージを利用したシステム[/b]
メルブラではマジックサーキット(従来の格闘ゲームで必殺技を使用するときに消費するゲージのこと)を使用した様々な行動が可能になります。
その中でも特にメルブラ独特のシステムである『強制解放』について説明します。

マジックサーキット(ゲージ)が100%以上残っている状態でA+B+Cを押すことで発動することができ、発動時に敵が近くにいた場合、敵を画面端まで吹っ飛ばすことができます。
強制解放中はマジックサーキット(ゲージ)が0%になるまで徐々に減少していきますが、その間自身の体力ゲージが徐々に回復していき、強制解放中は制限時間が止まった状態となります。

このシステムによって、相手の体力が少なくなったときや制限時間ぎりぎりの戦いで、敵がどのタイミングで強制解放を行うかかを読みあう心理戦を味わうことができます。

強制解放以外にもサーキットスパークやアナザーアークドライブなどゲージを使用したシステムが存在します。
※ただし、3つの戦闘スタイルによっては使用できないシステムもありますので、要注意です。


[b]■ゲージの持ち越し[/b]
ゲームが2ラウンド以上先取の対戦を行う場合、1ラウンド目が終わった時点でのゲージを2ラウンド目に持ち越すようになっています。

そのため、ゲージがたくさんある状態で2ラウンドが始まるのと、ゲージが0の状態で始まる場合とでは戦いにちょっとした差が生まれてきます。


[h1]このゲームの良い点[/h1]
・月姫に登場した多彩なキャラクターが使用できる。
　月姫が元なので当たり前なのですが、月姫の登場キャラクターが多数でてきます。
　なので、「格闘ゲームはやったことないけど、月姫は知ってる！」という方にもおすすめです。
　また、映画化もされた小説『空の境界』のキャラクター「両義式」もこのゲームで使用することができます。

・白熱した読みあいや心理戦
　既存の格闘ゲームの読みあいに加え、強制解放やサーキットスパークなどメルブラ特有のシステムもあるのでより相手の考えを上回る読みが必要になります。

・新規追加されたランクマッチ
　アーケード、コンシューマ、PCにはなかった「ランクマッチ機能」が追加されています。
　ランクマッチ機能を使えば、強い人に一方的にボコボコにされ続けることもないかと思います。


[h1]このゲームの悪い点[/h1]
・玄人プレイヤーが多い？
　10年以上前からあるゲームなので、プレイヤーの中にはすでに全国大会レベルのプレイヤーもいると思います。
　ですので、steamで発売されたばかりだからといって、皆同じスタートラインではないのでご注意ください。

[strike]・オンラインマッチングができない(自分の環境の場合)
　私の環境では、オンラインマッチングをしようとするとゲームが強制終了してしまい、マッチングができませんでした。
　(他のプレイヤーはオンラインマッチングができていたので全員ができないわけではないです[/strike]
　※追記　オンラインマッチングができない不具合は修正され、現在はマッチングできています。
　(アークシステムワークスの素早い対応に感謝)

[h1]総評[/h1]
2Dの格闘ゲームの中では比較的初心者向けの格闘ゲームだと思います。
(とはいえ、コンボゲーなので格闘ゲーム完全初心者の人にとってはまだ難しいかもしれません)

しかし、基本エリアル(コンボ)ができるようになれば、大体のキャラクターは似たような操作でできるので、そこまで頑張ればあとは何とかなるんじゃないかなと思います。
(私は「Act Cadenza」をよくプレイしていて、「Actress Again」からはほとんどプレイしていないのでハーフムーンやフルムーンについては違うかもしれません)

格闘ゲーム初心者の人も、格闘ゲーム大好きな人も皆楽しくプレイできるタイトルだと私は思います。


■追記
基本コンボの簡単な説明つき動画あげました。
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eTBH0D9h9lU&feature=youtu.be

月姬作为让型月走向同人巅峰的起点，长期受困于画风古老、久无新作、缺乏扩展性导致的低人气状态。MeltyBlood系列几乎是多年以来让玩家不把这些丰富多彩的人物彻底遗忘的唯一存在，并且让许多原本不了解月姬的玩家开始走进月世界。特别是在国内，MB与非想天则堪称同人格斗游戏之双璧，持续为型月和东方带来许多粉丝。可惜的是2D格斗日趋小众的今天就是这两个最有人气的系列也不能避免衰落的命运。希望今后Steam这个更广阔的平台能够支持MeltyBlood系列推出画面更好、内容更丰富的新作品。

优点：
-内置改键，支持手柄/摇杆
-网战大厅、排行、观战
-游戏内容及社区功能完整
（想了想这些优点难道不是应该的吗？可能是被日厂喂屎太多看到正常游戏反应不过来了。）

缺点：
-日文乱码
-4:3略落后于时代
-偶尔不明原因掉帧

22530657.review:
As a player being torn between recommending and not recommending this game, I ultimately went with recommending this game. There are ups and downs, and I don't mean this towards the core gameplay. That part specifically is sheerly preference. If you want to know if this game is fun, watch reviews, look at tournament footage, pirate first and buy later. I won't get deep into detail about the core game.

Melty is an old game and it has not seen a US release for almost a decade if not already. Melty seeing a steam release is beyond phenomenal, obviously. If you're a hardcore Melty lover, here's your chance to throw your money away in blind support.

Now, this is a very early review. A VERY early review. I have my doubts, but there's a chance that new content or possibly even DLC could exist, but seeing as how dead the game is nowadays, this is highly unlikely. French Bread has moved on to other products. It was a miracle to even get a rank match system, which is one of the ups the steam version has. It also has wide screen which doesn't really do much but show you a portion of the characters' movelist.

Here's some Pros and Cons. Content wise, it's a little disappointing that the only thing that's NEW to this steam version is having an english translation and a matching system. If you look at the console versions of Melty, you'd see that it has a lot more content, such as the boss rush mode, eclipse moon style, secret bosses, and whatever else that I can't think of. I'm actually unsure why the completely removed team battles from Act Cadenza, not to mention. Not even the console version kept it. Maybe it just wouldn't work the the new system, who knows. But oh well.

Now for some additional details. When initially playing the game on ranked, I found a lot of super laggy players who ended up quitting immediately. After messing with the filtering for a bit, I actually got quite a few matches that were really good with the connection filter set to at least 1+. You may want to do 2+, but depending on how slowly you get matches (and the popularity of the game), you may want to put the numbers lower. The netcode ain't perfect, but it's tolerable and I can do decent combos against opponents on the fly. There's also no rollback either. In general, I had a decently fun time fighting new opponents every now and then. At first, my filter was a bit strict and I kept getting only 2 of the same people, but after putting some more leniency on the filters, I got a lot more people, new people everytime, almost. In short, don't choose "ANYONE" for your connection filter, I personally had a bad time with it.

In closing... if you're a melty fanatic, get this game if you really want to support it. The online and english features gives us english speakers access to the game. It makes the game more accessible and doesn't force us to have to pirate it just to play it without importing or some nonsense. Even without the steam version coming out, there's an entire community out there on a site called meltybread.com who has a few other connections as well, one of them being a Discord channel dedicated to melty banter and matches. Heck, even the fanmade patches and mods have MORE features than the steam version! The CCCaster being a prime example! There are a lot of ways to get consistent matches with people around your skill level WITHOUT the steam version. But obviously, this is NOT about being able to simply being able to play the game. This is exposure and that's what counts. I honestly do not know how far this game will come, now that it's on steam, but to be brutally honest, I'm sort of pessimistic about it. This is part of the reason why I feel Melty should be a little bit cheaper than what it is now, even with the current discount that makes it $19.99. But... hey, I'm still recommending this, aren't I? That just shows you how much I like the game.

22529546.review:
Ох, этот прекрасный момент, когда твой любимый файтан спустя столько лет появляется в стимачах, и ты можешь адекватно отдать денюшку разработчикам, а не ебаться с кряками и патчами.

Постараюсь быть относительно лаконичным.

+ Быстрый, очень активный файтан. Медленных персонажей штуки три, остальные весьма активны. Дрочи ты комбы или просто баттл меш - игра не стоит на месте.

+ Простая и удобная боевая система. Боёвка в 3 кнопки? В самый раз. Хотя вру, 5, но 2 других весьма ситуативны, хотя бесспорно важны. Никаких долгих разборов в механнике или непоняток аля "как эта хуйня, мать его, должна работать". Всё макимально просто и интуитивно понятно.

+ Персонажи. Их дохуя, они классные и разнообразны. Поклонникам Тсукихиме и Насуверса в целом будет в самый раз, да и новичкам в этом деле есть возможность подобрать себе персонажа по вкусу. И пусть вас не смущают персонажи "клоны". ПУсть внешне похожи в реалиях самих себя они весьма разные, за исключением Акихи и парных персов. Ну а если уж по стилю игры ваша новая вайфу вам не шибко подходит, тот в дело вступает следущий пункт.

+ Боевые стили. По три на перса с одной основой на стили и с большим разнообразием на персонажей. Тут можно описывать влияние стилей на игровую механнику, но проще это дело просувствовать.

+ Грабы в воздухе.

+ Музыка. Пожалуй, единственный файтинг, где я не переключаю музыку на свою. Не всё идеально и есть треки, которые не доставляют или даже раздражают, но в большинстве своём игра обладает солидным набором классных и запоминающихся треканов, которые хосется слушать просто так.

- Цена? Мне не такой уж и минус, однако игра всё же старенькая.

- Я, пожалуй, слишком фанат за достаточное делгое время и весьма лоялен к игре, чтобы выискивать в ней минусы. Простите.

Лично для меня 10/10 топовый файтан как по небольшому и весьма казуальному опыту игры в файтаны так и по некоторым личным причинам.
Будет ли оно так для вас? Не знаю. Однако Мелти Блад один из лучших 2D файтингов, которые видал свет.

22529355.review:
不记得我是初中生还是高中生的时候了，总之就是懵懂的小男孩。有一次在国内的VeryCD社区也就是电驴找游戏玩，偶然下载了一个格斗游戏，人物立绘对当时格斗游戏只玩过拳皇的我来说非常美型。选一个和我差不多的穿蓝衣服戴眼镜的boy就开始瞎打。

打过金发女，打过女仆，还打过黑/红长直妹妹，给我留下了非常深刻的印象(没有指欺负妹妹时的声音喔绝对没有)。

现在想来那就是第一次和型月的邂逅吧。我对月姬人物的所有初次印象和情感都源于月姬格斗。虽然当时看不懂剧情，但是少年时的我能从人物形象和他们的配音去感受。

所以型月作品系列中我一直更喜欢月姬，所以虽然两仪式在国内人气挺高的(saber除外)，这里的游戏评论我看了看也是如此，但一号主角在我心中永远只有志贵，这个如今很少被人提起还要莫名被黑的人，在我眼里却是集洒脱、圆滑、戏谑、执着、冷冽于一体的人。我读书时就认为很酷的角色，直死魔眼还是看他感觉比较帅。女性角色则是偏爱秋叶和翡翠啦。

之后才接触月姬游戏本篇，那是我开始玩Galgame的事情了，才知道月姬本体是没有配音的。失望啊!(没有其他特别的意思)和其它先看那部真月谭喵姬动画的不同，我对人物的声音早已经和月姬格斗挂钩了，所以大学时看幻想嘉年华时觉得倍感亲切。

现在游戏终于上steam了，我也工作有财力了，完全可以为当年补票了。月姬的人物，还是月姬格斗的形象看的亲切，至于月姬R那个saber脸贞德发型的公主……就那样了吧。武内开心就好。

=========================================================================================

操作按键:WASD是方向键包括跳跃，UIOJ对应按钮ABCD。

游戏画面两旁有人物出招表可以看还是挺人性化的。游戏菜单怎么调出来倒是搞不明白，瞎按了steam菜单的shift+tab键一起把游戏菜单调出来了，可以改键位。（后来发现了，菜单键直接按TAB键就可以了）

如果只是想看剧情的话，剧情关卡不怎么难，我这种手残瞎打也可以打过。顺便坐等收集卡片。

配音虽然没换声优，但感觉腔调似乎和初版月姬格斗略有区别了。(哎呀我家秋叶妹妹的福利没了)

至于很多人反映的网战卡，反正我是个手残，暂时还没考虑到这一步，等我先打完所有剧情以及电脑对战模式再看吧，估计也只会私下和几个基友玩一下了。
（已经和基友联机过了，是在好友名单中直接邀请的方式，至少用这样的方式我是一点都不卡）

另外还有人说选了人之后按ESC无法取消撤回，实际上选人时取消的键并不是ESC，而是对应手柄操作的B按钮的“I”键。是可以取消选人的。

Fate的世界发展到如今已经太过庞大枝繁叶茂。(并不是不好，但是大批Fate厨对着FGO聊得热火朝天，再看月姬一年又一年没人提起，偶有提到也是拜月姬漫画所赐，总会感到失落,尤其是像我一样喜欢志贵、秋叶、翡翠的人可能不如喜欢式、公主的多吧，顺便同情下学姐和五月)

再回来看月姬格斗人物，夜晚的月世界，还有游戏的开场动画，让我有一种回家的感觉。
【扣分点：M了个及，steam背景你其他几个人都上了，唯独没有我秋叶？？？在月姬中最多立绘姿态的秋叶，在月姬格斗中继承这一传统以同一人身份独享3+1种形态的秋叶，你告诉我没steam背景？？？差评，搞得合卡动力都没了啊，蘑菇求您老人家来做主啊 T T】

Let it be known that I have dozens of hours off of steam on this game, and can easily say this is my favorite fighting game.

+The game has 31 characters and three completely different versions of each, it's pretty much impossible for you to not enjoy playing every character because of this. Not only that, but each has 36 different colors to choose from. FOR FREE!

+The movement is increidbly crisp and clean and anything you want your character to do you probably can do. 

+ Combos are a little difficult but they each have a pretty basic way to do an ok combo, their is more in depth combos to master as well but if you wanna just play the game for fun you can do that as well with just a little bit of time.

+ You can combo into air grabs, so fucking juicy.

+ You can grab people out of wake up supers as well, FUCK YOU STREET FIGHTER!

+ Voice acting is really good, even if I don't speak Japanese. lol

- With all that being said the game is really fast and the offense is really powerful, you might be stuck in blockstrings for a long ass time and most of the time you'll have to burn meter if your character doesn't have a reversal, so losing can be super irritiating.

- A lot of the characters are visible clones of each other, so bad to the point that the difference between two characters is one wearing glasses and one is smirking, but visuals aside they all play very differently.

Try this game out, it's literally the best

22528843.review:
I've played Melty Blood for years with friends of mine, as well as the occasional netplay through CCCaster. This game is a lot of fun and quite easy to get into.

If you're looking for a fast paced fighting game, this is the one to get. There's no shortage of characters to choose from, with a huge variety of playstyles. The game is very well balanced for competitive play, but still is great for casual games.
I haven't delved much into the arcade mode story as there hasn't been an english translation around for very long, not to mention the AI is a bit wonky to say the least. Even so, arcade mode can still be fun. Either way, I think most people care more about playing against other people, so the arcade mode is good enough as it is.

At launch there was a lot of issues with latency and laggy games online for me and others as well, but that issue seems to have cleared up, so I'm looking forward to lots of great online play.

I love this game to death and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys fighting games. Do consider trying it out.

22528722.review:
今天上线，直接入手，不为什么，只为信仰。
由于我自己也是FTG苦手，所以只简单谈谈几点MB的优点和特色。
[list]
    [*]逆取消系统。这是我非常喜欢的，让MB的连招自由度变得极高，就算是新手也能瞎搓出一些伤害不错的连段。
    [*]屌爆的音乐，OST已经在我硬盘你待了7年多了，网易云上也是常驻。
    [*]STEAM版可以自设键位了，这点比以前方便多了。
    [*]月型系统。每个角色都有三种月型可选，招数会有一些变化。其实是一个可以深度开发的点，但我觉得并没有好好的利用到这个创意。
[/list] 
至于网战，我暂时还没试过，很多人都反馈过网战系统不够好，希望后续能修改好。
为了信仰大家都喂钱给蘑菇了，我感觉月姬2和月姬重置又是遥遥无期了。如此一想对于MBAACC上架的心情变得有点儿微妙了。
至于进游戏画面马赛克的问题，进游戏后选择OPTION→SCREEN FILTER ON，就可解决。
----------------------------------------------------------------------

22528053.review:
after years upon years of having to pirate this gem, its finally available for steam release. This has been a favorite of mine for about a third of my life now, and the awsome, slick looseness of melty blood is something you really dont find in any other fighting game. its one of a kind

the core gameplay here is as good as always. the game is slick and insanely fast-paced, and combos are really fluid (emphasis on "fluid" as opposed to them having a lot of weight). the game is really beginner friendly, too; theres no tutorial, but there isnt an insane plethora of systems here to overwhelm you, attacks are easy to use and combo with, and specials all use relatively universal motions that are easy to execute

its worth noting that this is a game based a lot on combos, which might be weird for some people. a common match involves a lot of moving around really fast, trying your darndest to catch the opponent off guard, and once you can get them, wiping out about a quarter to half of their HP bar. obv a fight is more complicated than that, because peeps arent going to let you get them into good combos, so you gotta have experience to back up your execution

[b]as for online play[/b], i think it may be too early to come to a good conclusion, but immediately after launch, connection quality varied wildly. you could get some matches that were good, or sometimes you could get a full second or more of delay. more often than not, a fight would start fine but the latency would gradually creep in during. as it settled down, i suppose, connections started to get much better. maybe its late and so not a lot of people are on; for whatever reason the server was running smoothely, and a majority of the fights i had felt like they may as well be local

i cant really judge the quality of multiplayer lobbies, but its quite functional here. you can quick ranked matches or costumized ones (where you can prefer to fight peeps from your region or whatever), and you can do normal player matches. unranked matches can only be done in rooms (of up to 6 people), and thats pretty weird, but i dont really mind it

i think this game is really worth everyones time, obv i recommend it. $25 is a pretty steep price for this old of a game with so little production value, though

22528048.review:
Melty Blood: Actress Again Current Code has finally made its release years after being unobtainable other than through a $200 bundle with an anime series. It is an impressive game with very fluid character movement and an intuitive combo system, allowing for both new players to quickly dish out pressure and combos after just starting while rewarding long time players for truly optimizing their characters. Surprisingly, the older, PS2 version of the game had made enough of a name for itself in the US to be voted into EVO 2010 over many other popular fighters at the time. To this day, many fighting game players know of it and have tried it.

The translation work done on the game is excellent, as it now allows for some players to appreciate aspects of characters they were unable to read before. Seeing as this is also one the official release of the latest Melty Blood, I am also sure a lot of Japanese players who did not already own it are thankful for a digital copy.

Unfortunately, the game suffers some drawbacks on release. For one, there have been players who have been playing this game, in particular this version, for several years, so some player matches and ranked will turn out to be a daunting experience. However, it is a very easy game to learn, and there have been so many tutorial videos on each of the characters (93 characters if we include moon forms), the game could be played with purely fighting game fundamentals.

The netplay is fairly attrocious; delay is compounded during matches, so the longer a match draws out, the more input delay both parties will have to suffer. The bundled MBAACC that could be purchased years ago contained a solid netplay matching system and recognizable delay. Considering the other types of netplay ArcSys and FrenchBread have developed for their most recent games, this is really a sour experience.

Overall, I do recommend this game for the fun factor. However, I feel that some aspects still need some work to finalize into a great fighter.

Muy divertido para jugar entre amigos. Malo para jugar en Linea (Por ahora espero). Relativamente facil de aprender. 3 estilos de juego para 31 personajes. OH y por cierto aunque paresca que muchos de los personajes se repiten NO SON CLONES, cada uno cambia su estilo de juego enormemente.

22527809.review:
Melty Blood is a momentum and pressure-centric fighting game.
I'll try to cover what makes melty unique compared to other fightans:

-Simple and low res, but very fluid and stylish spritework. This makes it easier to see and recognize startup animations.

-Easy motions for special moves; nothing more complex than a half-circle motion. Combined with the relatively large buffer window for specials, melty is an easy game to pick up and mash for anybody familiar with fighting games.

-Very loose cancel window after normals. In C and H moon, you can pretty much press any button after any other button. Gattlings are only present in F moon. This creates a technique called 'reverse beat', in which a move with a long recovery can be wiff canceled into a button with faster recovery. These properties mean that pressure if focused around normals; you want to leave a 1~2 frame gap between normals to catch people trying to do something other than blocking.

-Throw properties. The character waking up has a few frames of throw invincibility and can OS with 1ad. They are relatively weak and hard to hit given the speed and reach of 2a. Once you earn respect, you can't just spam throw to win the round, instead you must continue pressurring with normals in order to get an opening.

-Teching when hitting the ground is done by holding a direction. There is a short hop with invlun followed by a brief vulnerable recovery. During oki there is no vairable timing, which means that the person waking up may get caught in a meaty attack if they choose to tech incorrectly. This heavily favors the attacking player as they can do a combo and follow it up with another one if done correctly. Blocking and teching properly becomes important skills in order to stay alive.

-Everybody gets a double jump AND an air dash. Air counterhits pop the enemy in the air and is untechable until they hit the ground. This is an easy, damaging, and important way to convert into a combo+knockdown. Most characters also lack an anti-air move. Given all this air mobility, the importance of air counterhits, and lack of grounded anti-airs means most of the footsies occur in the air.

-Crossup protection. Seeing how easy it is to hop on your opponent's head, the game has crossup protection, which allows you to block a crossup by still holding back. No gay ambiguous Ryu j.MK setups.

-2abc5c jbc jbc air throw. You now know the basic bnb for almost the entire cast. Less emphasis on combos, more  on spacing, pressure, and oki.

-Huge cast of viable characters. If you can get momentum, you can come back and win the round.

Melty Blood is easy to pick up and play, and if given a little bit of dedication and effort, can become an enjoyable fighting game experience.

22527432.review:
2002년부터 시작해 2010년에 끝나는 멜티블러드 시리즈 최종판 MBAACC의 이식판입니다.

본작은 원래 오락실, 그리고 애니메이션 블루레이 초회한정판 보너스로 수록된 PC판을 스팀으로 이식한 작품입니다.

MBAACC는 전전전전작품 MB(A)에서 발생했던 타타리 사건의 그 뒤 이야기를 다루고 있습니다만 본작은 메인스토리모드가 없어졌기 때문에 이는 별로 신경쓸 필요가 없습니다.

동인(아마추어)제작으로 유명한 게임이었고 상업적으로 바꾸어 어느정도의 성공을 했음에도 불구하고 도저히 발전이 안되는 도트그래픽과 밸런싱이 아주 가관입니다.

실제로 이식 전 게임과 전혀 달라진 것이 없고 달라진 것이라고 해도 아르카나하트3는 잘써먹었는데 이것들은 어따 팔아먹었는지 성의도 없는 기술표나 툭 그려준 와이드 보정이미지가 끝입니다.

기술표는 대부분 같지만 캐릭터마다 다른 기술을 쓰며 이마저도 3가지 모드의 따라 바뀌어 특색있는 콤보를 낼 수 있는 것이 특징인 점은 처음하시는 분들은 굉장히 재밌어할 부분입니다.

또 모든 캐릭터가 일본 프로성우들의 열연으로 가득한  풀보이스로 녹음되어있어 스토리의 몰입감이 매우 높습니다. 흡혈귀, 무술소녀, 살인마, 수상쩍은메이드, 흡혈귀, 쿵푸소녀, 살인귀, 수상쩍은 메이드 등의 다채로운 캐릭터로 아케이드 모드의 스토리 하나하나가 매우 흥미진진하며 재밌습니다. 그리고 TYPE-MOON팬 분들이라면(이미 플레이 하셨겠지만 ) 더더욱 좋아하실겁니다.

MBAA에서는 보스 러시가 백미였는데 여기서는 안나와서 좀 아쉬운 부분이긴 합니다. 그리고 4번째 모드인 이클립스 모드는 블레이블루처럼 캐릭터 아케이드모드 깬다고 해금되는 것도 아니고 CPU전용이라 처음접하시는 분들은 좀 아쉬워할지도 모르겠습니다.

넷플레이 환경이 스팀으로 바뀌는 것만으로 해도 메시아가 지상으로 내려올 만큼의 큰 복음과도 같습니다. 다만 미칠듯한 랙과 넷코드, 고수밖에 없는 서버는 처음 시작하는 사람에게는 굉장한 거부감이들 가능성이  있습니다.
 라이브러리에 소장하시고 싶다면 적극 추천합니다.

22527195.review:
I never played much of Melty Blood before but I've noticed it talked about in high esteem plenty of times, so I gave it a buy.

[b]Pro[/b]

[*] Large and colourful character roster.
[*] Works with all sorts of controllers. Detected my PS4 fightstick and 360 controller without issue.
[*] Plenty of resolutions available as well as monitor selection.
[*] Showing special move inputs on the side is an elegant way to work around the aspect ratio.

[b]Con[/b]

[*] No borderless full-screen option.
[*] No reworked/updated graphics. Don't expect BlazBlue level graphics out of this.
[*] Hefty price for a port on a niche platform when it comes to anime fighters.
[*] Network play seems hit or miss.

[b]Verdict[/b]

Seems to be a port in the purest sense of the word. However, it fucking works and it's actually legal. If you're into anime fighters and/or want to encourage more devs to bring fighters to pc, get this. Melty is a classic.

22527132.review:
Like many others writing the early reviews, I have hundreds of hours of play on this game pre-localization and steam release. Even with that, I am still a scrubby nooblet. This game is quite deep, and takes a lot to master, but it is also fairly accessable at a base level, only having 3 buttons and straight forward chains.

+ Amazing balance and depth
+ Dedicated community that has stuck around and will still continue to stick around
+ Fast gameplay that rewards aggression
+ While not a HD remake, they have smoothed out the sprites and touched up the backgrounds, several with very nice ambient effects
+ Over 90 characters due to the Moon system (31 characters with 3 moon styles = 93 possible playable characters)
+ Great characters — albeit, on average less outrageous than most others
+ Satsuki Yumizuka

- The game does not have a challenge/trial system, which means that you have to look up and figure things out entirely from third party sources, which presents a barrier to entry
- As mentioned by others, there are largely speaking only two sorts of players right now: the incredibly new, and the incredibly experienced. The experience gradient will even out over time
- As of release, the netplay is experiencing issues, but I am confident that it will be fixed relatively quickly—Arc System Works games generally have stellar netplay
- Some people might experience some lag on some of the revamped stages, such as the cherry blossom stage that now has actual cherry blossoms falling (it's pretty neat). I've heard there's an option to turn off sprite smoothing, but I don't know if it also changes the stages—I'm inclined to believe it does, but even if it doesn't, you can just avoid the problem stages

This is honestly the best-designed fighting game I've ever had the joy to play, and you should certainly give it a shot if you're considering.

22526778.review:
I play a lot of fighting games. But if there's one game I will take to a deserted island, it would be Melty Blood. Me and my siblings have been playing this for ~13 years.

Originally released in December 2002, this is a visual novel that happened to have a fighting game minigame. This was long before BlazBlue introduced the idea to the mainstream. The game's story is a continuation of Tsukihime and (surprisingly), is canon and explains how dead characters returned to life to fight with the small roster.

The original game was broken. A lot of moves have shield frames (meaning, if this move hits another move, no damage is done but you can cancel to a different move) which lead to anime-esque fights with freeze frames everywhere as players switch moves to try to break through. Also, the post-victory screen will not end until the defeated character is on the ground. Meaning, if you killed your opponent while they're on the air, you can juggle them almost infinitely before the round will officially end (like other airdashers, the longer a combo is, the heavier the opponent becomes).

Regardless, this game has a lot of innovations. Some of them are:
- This game has 3 buttons and a dedicated shield button (think of it like Street Fighter V Ryu's parry but you can cancel to other moves) - which makes each character easy to play. 
- Melty Blood has no chip death making to exciting matches. 
- Characters can use their meter to gain a new gauge (called HEAT) that slowly goes down. During this time, the character regenerates life AND stops the clock. This makes the timer an important resource to manage. It is common for a player to stop the clock when its almost over and run away (or rushdown) to maintain the lead.
- Super moves on a successful parry during HEAT.

Later expansions in the series include Re-ACT (PC), ReACT Final Tuned (PC), Act Cadenza (Arcade), Act Cadenza Ver.B (PS2), Act Cadenza Ver.B (PC), Actress Again (PC), Actress Again Current Code (PC). ...if you think Street Fighter's naming convention is crazy, French Bread has taken it to the extreme.

The game released on Steam will have the following features:
- More characters! There are now 31 characters.
- Each character have 3 different fighting style which each plays completely different. Effectively, this game has 31 multiply by 3 characters
- Balance
- Updated story (very important for those who wanted more Tsukihime)

This game is so popular that it was referenced in the Type-Moon fan-service OVA, Carnival Phantasm. 

The Melty Blood fighting community love this game so much, that we have no problem playing the grand finals at a parking lot or airport lounge. This is how dedicated we are to this game.

If you haven't played this gem and you love fighting games, give Melty Blood a shot. Who knows? Maybe you'll be airdashing with the rest of us for the next 13 years.

22526645.review:
Don't be fooled by my small playtime. I've actually played this game quite a bit before it's official english relase.

I have to say, this is one of the best fighting games I've ever played. It takes characters from the Tsukihime visual novel (THERE IS NO TSUKIHIME ANIME), as well as one character from Kara No Kyoukai, and puts them in a fighting game. Since I had already played Tsukihime, I am definitely a bit biased, as I am already quite invested in these characters. But despite that. I'm willing to reccomend it as a very good fighting game.

Here are some questions that you may have for the game.
Q: How does this differ from the Japanese release of MBAACC wtih Mirror Moon's english patch?
A: There are several improvements. Firstly, Mirror Moon was not able to finish the translations of some of the character's story arcade modes. This includes Nanaya Shiki, Roa, and a few others. In addition, this version offers controller configuration and keyboard configuration within the game's option menu. In the original release of the game, keyboard configuration was done in a separate, non-translated .exe. Also, pressing the escape key won't immediately cause the game to exit, like it does in the orignal. This version also lists the combos on the side panels.

Q: The store page says that this is the final episode of a series. Do I need to play the previous episodes?
A: That depends. If you only interested in the fighting part of this fighting game, you only need this game, as it is superior to all previous versions in term of fighting mechanics. However, playing at least the first game in the series (Melty Blood) is essential to understanding the storyline of this game, and anyone who hasn't played Tsukihime will be COMPLETELY lost. However, the fighting mechanics in the original Melty Blood are a bit....crap in comparison to this game. In addition, the original Melty Blood featured a story-to-combat ratio of at least 10:1, maybe as high as 30:1.

Q: How's the translation?
A: I haven't played the arcade mode for very long, but what I've seen appears to be good enough. I'll update this later after I've seen more. I might even upload some screenshot comparisons if i can be bothered.

Q: I don't know anything about Tsukihime. However, I like Guitly Gear and BlazBlue. Will I like this?
A: Yes. MBAACC uses the three-button attack sytem of Guilty Gear and BlazBlue, so any player of these games should feel right at home in this one. Heck, I'd argue that this games is BETTER than Guilty Gear XX and BlazBlue Calamity Trigger. However, as I mentioned previously, I may be a bit biased.

Overall, I recommend this game to fighting game fans and fans of Type-Moon. I also recommend this to people who already "own" a copy of the Japanese version.

This review is dedicated to Miyu Matsuki, the voice actor of Hisui who is sadly no longer with us.
